children.title: AI Guides: Approved AI Tools
children.content:
Simplifi Guidelines: AI Employee Usage

As an employee, it is your responsibility to understand how AI systems process data and to ensure that only suitable information is entered into these systems. This obligation is an extension of the confidentiality clause you signed upon your employment with Simplifi.

Any incidents involving the disclosure of confidential or highly confidential information, whether within these systems or similar ones, may lead to disciplinary action.

For general inquiries regarding AI tools, please reach out to the #digital-workplace Slack channel or Request Access to approved Ai tools.

If you have questions about your responsibilities in evaluating AI tools for personal use or need guidance on initiating a compliance review, please refer to the following pages:

AI Usage Policy and Guidelines: Individual Employee Use

Simplifi Enterprise AI Implementation and Non-Public Information Usage Policy

We encourage everyone to default to Gemini, our official AI tool. Other approved tools are listed below:

List of Approved AI Tools

  • Gemini (already available in your Okta dashboard)

  • Cursor (Request Access)

  • Open AI’s ChatGPT (Request Access)

  • GitHub Copilot (Request Access)

  • Make (Request Access)

  • Waymark (Request Access)

  • Dall-E

  • Grammarly

  • Copilot (this includes the use of autocomplete for code writing)

  • ChatSpot AI by GitHub

  • Zoom AI

  • Reclaim AI

  • Monday

  • Asana

  • Clockwise

  • Typewise
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: AI Usage Policy and Guidelines: Individual Employee Use
children.content:
FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT DISTRIBUTE

Simplifi empowers employees to leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI) for day-to-day operations to enhance productivity. This document outlines the process and steps required for the safe and compliant use of AI for individual employee use. Adhering to these guidelines helps prevent misuse of company proprietary information and security incidents, ensuring data protection and compliance with legal limits and privacy policies.

Support or Feedback

For questions, comments, or feedback regarding this AI policy or AI usage, please contact Ryan Falsetti, Privacy Compliance Manager, via Slack or email the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi. The Privacy Team is available to assist with any inquiries related to AI compliance, data use, and security.

Mandatory AI Tool Approval Checklist: Before Using New AI Systems

Before deploying any new AI system, AI tool, or AI software, employees must complete the following checklist to ensure safe and approved AI usage. This process helps troubleshoot potential compliance issues and data risks.

1. Legal Compliance and Approved Tools

  • Approved AI Tools: Check if the AI tool is already approved for Simplifi use. A list of existing software tools with Embedded AI Tools that are approved at Simplifi can be found [here - link to be inserted].

    • Unlisted Tools: If an AI tool is not listed on the approved software list, its use is not prohibited automatically. However, you must notify the Compliance Team (via the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi) about the tool being used for their records. The Compliance Team will then add it to the approved list after review.

  • Legal Expertise & Contract Review:

    • Does the AI tool require legal expertise or involve the review of a contract?

    • If yes, you must follow the AI Use for Enterprise Process.

  • Non-Public Simplifi Information:

    • Will the AI tool process or use Non-Public Simplifi information?

    • If yes, you must follow the AI Use for Enterprise Process.

2. Data Use and Confidentiality

  • Confidential or Sensitive Information:

    • Will the AI process or use any confidential information or sensitive information?

  • Discrimination Risk:

    • Could the AI be used in a way that discriminates based on protected characteristics (e.g., gender, race, sexual orientation, political affiliation)? This includes potential bias in AI-generated content.

  • Action Required for Confidential/Sensitive Data:

    • If yes to either of the above data use questions, immediately email privacy@simpli.fi. Include all relevant information about the AI program and a list of the specific data elements you intend to use.

    • If no to both questions, you may proceed to the next step.

  • Privacy Assessment: Once the Privacy Team reviews the data use details, they will conduct a privacy assessment to identify and mitigate any areas of risk related to data handling and security.

3. Policy Review and External AI Privacy

  • Product Privacy Policy Review: You are required to review the product’s privacy policy for any AI system you intend to use.

    • Warning: Be highly cautious of privacy policies that allow all information entered into their system to be used to train their AI model. This poses a significant data privacy risk.

  • Data Collection & Usage Awareness:

    • Are you fully aware of what data the AI service collects and how that data is used by the third-party provider?

  • Concerns & Assistance:

    • If you have any questions or concerns about an AI product's privacy policy, send the policy to the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi for assistance and review.

  • Employee Liability: Remember, your actions play a direct role in the security of the organization. Depending on the scenario, employees could be held liable for misuse of company proprietary information or security incidents resulting from unapproved or non-compliant AI usage.

4. Review Plan for AI Output

  • Accuracy and Bias Check:

    • Is there a plan or process for reviewing AI-generated content (e.g., AI writing, AI data, summaries, code generation) for accuracy and bias?

  • Understandability & Verification:

    • Is the AI output something you fully understand and can verify for accuracy? This is critical for preventing incorrect information or misleading data.
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: Enterprise AI: Implementation and Non-Public Information Usage Policy
children.content:
FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT DISTRIBUTE

Simplifi recognizes Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a strategic component for developing and improving products, processes, and procedures. This document outlines the essential steps required to implement AI at the Enterprise level or to use AI tools that handle non-public Simplifi information. Adhering to this policy ensures compliance, data security, and proper risk management for all enterprise AI initiatives.

Support or Feedback

For questions, comments, or feedback concerning this Enterprise AI policy or the AI approval process, please contact Ryan Falsetti, Privacy Compliance Manager, via Slack or email the Compliance Team directly at privacy@simpli.fi. The Compliance Team is available to assist with your inquiries and provide guidance on AI implementation and compliance requirements.

Enterprise AI Approval Process

This multi-step approval process is mandatory for all enterprise AI projects and AI tools using non-public Simplifi data. Following these steps will streamline AI adoption while ensuring security and regulatory compliance.

Step One: Initial Discussion and Request Submission

  • Manager Discussion: Begin by discussing the AI tool and its specific use case with your manager or team lead. Clarify the purpose and benefits of the AI integration.

  • Paid AI Tools:

    • If the AI tool is paid software, obtain manager approval.

    • Your manager must then submit the request to the Procurement team by creating a Jira ticket. This initiates the procurement process for the new AI solution.

  • Free AI Tools using Non-Public Information:

    • If the AI tool is free but will be processing or using non-public Simplifi information (e.g., confidential data, proprietary data, sensitive company information), you must create a Jira ticket.

    • For the "Project" field in Jira, select "Compliance." This action automatically kicks off a compliance review for the AI tool and its intended data use.

Step Two: Compliance Review and Assessment Forms

  • Compliance Team Contact: After creating the Jira ticket (for either procurement or compliance), the Compliance Team will contact you.

  • Privacy & AI Pre-Assessment Forms: If deemed necessary, you will receive a copy of the Privacy Pre-Assessment form and the included AI Pre-Assessment Form.

    • Completing these forms is crucial for the Compliance Team to understand what data is being used by the AI tool and how it will be processed, handled, and stored.

  • Data Privacy/Security Assessment Determination: The Compliance Team will review the completed assessment forms. Based on this review, they will determine whether a full Data Privacy/Security Assessment needs to be conducted, especially if the AI use case involves high-risk processing or falls under regulations like GDPR and CCPA.

Step Three: Risk Assessment and Documentation

  • High-Risk Processing Assessment: If a Data Privacy/Security Assessment needs to be conducted due to high-risk processing (e.g., handling Personal Identifiable Information (PII), sensitive data categories, large-scale data processing), the Compliance Team will conduct this additional assessment with you. This collaborative process ensures all risks are identified and mitigated.

  • No Assessment Required (Documented Justification): If an assessment does not need to be done due to the low nature of the risk, the Compliance Team will produce clear documentation stating that a risk assessment is not required and will explain the rationale. This decision will be documented in Vanta for audit and record-keeping purposes.

Step Four: Implementation and Ongoing Management

  • Ongoing Compliance Communication: As you implement the AI tool, it is critical to keep the Compliance Team apprised of any new developments, changes in scope, or unexpected changes related to the AI system or its data usage.

  • Compliance Team Involvement for High-Risk Projects:

    • If PII (Personal Identifiable Information) is being used by the AI tool, or if the AI tool could present a security risk if not implemented properly, you must invite the relevant Compliance Team members to planning and onboarding calls.

    • Their assistance during these critical phases is vital to ensure proper security controls and data governance are in place from the outset, preventing project delays or compliance issues down the line. This proactive engagement is key to successful and secure AI deployment.

children.title: Adobe Dashboard Guide: Logging into Adobe Dashboard/Local Apps with Okta SSO
children.content:
This guide covers the generic Adobe sign-in page which provides access to all your assigned Adobe applications. However, for a more streamlined experience, logging in directly to the specific Adobe app is often recommended, especially if you primarily use only one. Most Adobe applications can be accessed directly via their dedicated Adobe domain http://acrobat.adobe.com

Secure Authentication with Okta SSO

At Simplifi, we prioritize security. We require signing in with Okta SSO (Single Sign-On). This method provides significantly enhanced platform security compared to the less secure AdobeID which relies on traditional username/password authentication.

While Adobe supports Okta authentication, the login process itself is initiated on the Adobe side. For your convenience, an Adobe application tile is available on your Okta dashboard to facilitate easy access.

Steps to log into Adobe Dashboard and Apps:

  1. Navigate to Adobe.com: This will take you to the Adobe home page.

  2. Click Sign In: Locate and click the "Sign In" button in the top right corner of the Adobe home page.

    Adobe.com sign page

  3. Enter Simplifi Email: On the Adobe sign-in page, type in your Simplifi email address. Then, click "Continue."

  4. Select "Company or School Account": This action will lead you to a new page. You might see a similar view or only the "Company or School Account" option. Select "Company or School Account" to proceed with Okta authentication.
    Upon completing these steps, you should be signed into your Enterprise Adobe dashboard.

Authentication & Troubleshooting

  • Okta Prompt: If you are not already signed into Okta when you access the Adobe sign-in page directly, you will be prompted for your Okta credentials.

  • MFA Prompts: There may be instances where you are prompted for MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) even if you are already signed into Okta. This is a normal behavior of Adobe's session cookie processing and helps maintain secure access.

Did you know there is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar that provides quick and easy access to all your apps? If you don't see it, simply click the puzzle piece icon and then select the pin next to the Okta Browser plugin. This will allow you to log in to your account swiftly and access all your apps with ease!

  3. Initiate Sign-In: This will direct you to the Adobe Acrobat Enterprise/Pro home page.(Depending on your license) In the top right corner, click "Sign In."

  • MFA Prompts: There may be instances where you are prompted for MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication), even if you are already signed into Okta. This is a normal part of Adobe's session cookie processing and helps maintain a secure connection.

There is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps? If you don't see it, click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. From here you can quickly log in to your account and quick access to ALL your apps!

children.title: Adobe Creative Cloud Suite Guide: Logging into Adobe CCS with Okta SSO
children.content:
This document provides a step-by-step guide for logging into Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using Okta and Single Sign-On (SSO)

Enhanced Security with Okta SSO

At Simplifi, we prioritize security by leveraging Okta SSO for accessing platforms like Adobe Creative Cloud Suite. This method offers significantly enhanced security compared to the less secure AdobeID, which relies on traditional username/password authentication.

While Adobe fully supports Okta authentication, the actual login process is initiated on the Adobe side. For your convenience, an Adobe application tile is readily available on your Okta dashboard, designed to direct you straight to the login page.

Steps to Log In to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite

Follow these steps to securely log in to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using your Simplifi credentials:

Follow these steps to securely log in to Adobe Creative Cloud Suite using your Simplifi credentials:

  1. Access Okta Dashboard: First, log into your Okta dashboard by navigating to login.simpli.fi.

  2. Use Adobe Bookmark Tile: On your Okta dashboard, locate and click the bookmark icon tile for Adobe. This tile will take you directly to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite login page.
    You should see what is a bookmark icon tile to take you directly to the login page.

  1. Initiate Sign-In: This action will lead you to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite home page. In the top right corner, click "Sign In."

  1. Enter Simplifi Email: On the subsequent sign-in page, type your Simplifi email address into the designated field. Then, click "Continue.”

  1. Select Company or School Account: A new page will appear. You might see a similar view or only the "Company or School Account" option. Select "Company or School Account" to proceed with the Okta authentication flow.

Upon completing these steps, you should be successfully signed into your Adobe CCS dashboard, granting you full access to the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite.

Troubleshooting "Invalid Credentials" Errors

If you encounter an "invalid credentials" warning when attempting to log in to an Adobe application (like Adobe Creative Cloud Suite) locally, you can try the following troubleshooting steps:

  1. Open Creative Cloud Desktop App: Begin by opening the Creative Cloud desktop application.

  2. Select Help: In the desktop app menu, select "Help."

  3. Select Sign in using your browser: From the Help menu, choose "Sign in using your browser."

  4. Confirm Browser Sign-in: Select "Sign in with your browser" to open the sign-in page in your default web browser.

  5. Complete Browser Sign-in: Sign in using your browser. You may be prompted to verify with Okta if you are not already logged into Okta for the day.

  6. Return to Desktop App: After successful browser sign-in, return to the Creative Cloud desktop app. Your authentication issue should now be resolved.

Use the Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps!
Click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin.

children.title: AWS Key Guide: AWS Key Rotation Guidelines and Best Practices
children.content:
The Digital Workplace team's audit of user key rotation in Q3-Q4 2023 highlighted challenges not fully addressed by previous AWS documentation. This led to a re-evaluation of how Simplifi manages AWS access for external clients and internal users, particularly concerning AWS IAM Administration.

Historical Challenges with User Key Rotation

Historically, Simplifi provided AWS access to external clients by adding users to our AWS IAM Administration or, in some instances, by sharing users directly with clients. This approach has presented difficulties, especially with rotating user keys. To maintain compliance with the standards set by one of Simplifi's private equity firms (GTCR), user AWS keys must be rotated every 90 days. This requirement became problematic when managing numerous external client users.

Recommended Best Practice: AWS ARN for Bucket Policies

When granting external clients access to Simplifi S3 buckets, the recommended and most secure approach is to request the client's AWS ARNs (Amazon Resource Names) for the roles they maintain. These ARNs can then be directly added to the S3 bucket policy.

This method offers significant advantages over Simplifi maintaining individual users for clients:

  • It eliminates the need for Simplifi to manage and rotate client user keys every 90 days, ensuring ongoing compliance with key rotation standards.

  • It shifts the responsibility of user management and key rotation back to the client, simplifying Simplifi's IAM administration.

Future Enhancements and Current Support

The Infrastructure Value Stream Team is currently exploring long-term solutions, such as implementing the AWS KWS solution to auto-rotate AWS user keys for both clients and internal users.

In the interim, your assistance is crucial in encouraging clients to configure their AWS access at the bucket policy level using ARNs. This collaborative effort helps maintain our security posture and compliance.

Additional Context

For more context on the key rotation audit, please refer to the following Slack channel: #proj-aws-keys-update.

children.title: Digital Workplace Solutions: Jira Service Desk
children.content:
HALP!

The Digital Workplace team has historically assisted users through SIX different means:

  1. Okta Access Requests Portal

  2. Okta Slack App Access Shortcuts

  3. #digital-workplace Slack channel

  4. digitalworkplace@simpli.fi Email Address

  5. workflow-automations-notifications channel (alerts us when there are manual tasks to complete based on workflow triggers with applications that we set in Okta)

  6. Individual DMs in Slack (not recommended )

Help is Here

Beginning in Q2 2024, we started integrating our #digital workplace Slack channel with our Jira Service Desk. We did this in order to streamline the various ways we receive requests, but also because of a few added benefits for our customers (employees and contractors like you!):

  • With Atlassian Assist for Jira Service Desk, we can meet people where they like to communicate and automate ticket creation from these messages.

  • We can begin to enforce SLAs to ensure we’re meeting your expectations.

  • We can spot trends in agent activity, reporter activity, applications, and request types that can then inform more strategic changes to our service model.

  • With Atlassian Virtual Assist AI, we can automate the sharing of relevant documentation for initial triage so that you can get what you need sooner (and after hours!).

Help is Where?

As a result of this, you’ll begin to notice that your Slack messages in #digital-workplace give you the option to create a ticket immediately. Please select this option if you have a need that requires an action from our team (and is not just informational/knowledge-sharing).

  • Once you select the option for a ticket, a 🎫 emoji will appear beneath your Slack message.

  • When an agent wants to help you, you’ll notice they’ll put an emoji on it. This automatically assigns the corresponding ticket to them and moves it to “in progress” on the SLA clock.

  • If they are needing you or an outside party to take an additional step, the agent may move the issue to pending by adding an emoji beneath your original Slack message. This pauses the SLA timer given that the next action is out of their effective control.

  • When an issue is resolved, the agent will put a beneath your message. This closes the ticket in the service desk.

In other words, there’s very little you need to be doing differently; but you should see us improving your experience as we learn from the insights of our service project.

Can I still use the /access {application} shortcut in Slack or Okta Access Requests?

Yes. In fact, you might still get a reminder from our team to submit something with a Slack shortcut or Okta Access Request if it’s a basic access need. But we’ll work on automating those instructions for you so that your experience is a one-stop-shop in our #digital-workplace Slack channel.

On the backend, we’ll automate tickets for ourselves if there’s a manual step needed from either of those methods. We want you to use what you find easiest; but we never want you to have to think about where to go to submit a need.

Help Us Help You

In the coming months, we’ll be building out bot workflows to respond to keywords in your messages. These will share resources and tips with you related to your inquiry. However, it’s not going to be perfect.

Like any other language model or human behavior, it benefits from training. Give the bot feedback if it’s not helpful (it will ask!). Heck, give US feedback if we’re not helping you. Anything at all that you’d like to see working differently, let us know.

  • Give us a rating when we close your issue…

  • Leave us a comment in the issue’s thread in Slack…

  • Reach out to digitalworkplace@simpli.fi if there’s something the whole team needs to hear…

If you ever want to see the aggregated tickets that we receive (especially if searching for other’s who’ve had your issue), you can view the requests in our portal directly.

Introduction: Use Cases

Welcome, Digital Workplace Service Desk (DWS) agents! You've been added to our team to manage critical workflows across various areas. Your responsibilities include taking action on tickets related to:

  • Employee Lifecycle Events: Onboarding, off-boarding, role changes, etc.

  • Application Approvals: Managing access requests for applications you oversee.

  • Data Privacy and Compliance: Handling requests concerning sensitive data and regulatory adherence.

  • Hardware and Peripherals: Fulfilling requests for equipment and devices.

  • Security Incidents: Addressing and resolving security-related issues.

Managing Your Assigned Tickets

When a triggering event occurs, you'll receive an assigned ticket. This could be a task, access request, security request, hardware request, or a general support issue. Here are the instructions for how you can efficiently resolve these requests:

  • Accessing Your Tickets:

    • Log into Jira to view the Service Desk Portal issues assigned to you in your "My Open Issues" in the queue .

    • Alternatively, you can click the link in the Jira email notification you receive when an issue is assigned.

  • Changing Assignee:

    • To assign a ticket to yourself or reassign it to another DWS agent, select the "Assignee" field on the right-hand side of the issue in Jira. Choose the appropriate agent from the dropdown.

  • Updating Ticket Status:

    • Start Work: When you're ready to begin working on a ticket, change its status from "Open" to "Work in Progress." You can do this directly on the ticket in Jira, or by using the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel if the request originated there.
      → Will assign the ticket to you.
      → Will automatically close out the ticket
      -> Will assign to Work in Progress or Pending

    • Pause SLA (Pending): If you need to pause the SLA (Service Level Agreement) clock because you're waiting for information or action from the requester, a vendor, or another party, change the ticket status from "Work in Progress" to "Pending." You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel.

    • Close Ticket: Once you've successfully addressed and resolved the issue, change the ticket status from "Pending" or "Work in Progress" to "Closed." This can be done directly on the ticket in Jira, or via the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel.

  • Commenting on Issues:

    • You can add comments to an issue via Slack (if it originated in the #digital-workplace channel) or directly through the Jira interface.

    • Add internal note: Use this option if your comment is only for other service desk agents. This is ideal for resolution notes, troubleshooting steps, or questions for colleagues.

    • Reply to customer: Choose this option if your comment is intended to be visible to the requester. This will also send them an email notification, depending on their Jira notification settings.

  1. Log into Jira to see the Service Desk Portal issues you have assigned to yourself in the queue (My Open Issues).

    1. Alternatively, you can click the link in an email from Jira when notified of the issue assignment.

  2. To change an assignee (whether assigning to yourself or someone else), select the Assignee field on the right-hand side of the issue. You have the option to assign it to yourself or another person with agent access to the DWS service desk.

  3. When you are ready to start work on the ticket, move it from Open to Work in Progress .

    1. You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there.

  4. If you need to pause the SLA clock on a ticket because you are waiting on something from the requester, a vendor, or other party, move the ticket from Work in Progress to Pending .

    1. You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there.

  5. You can comment on the issue via Slack (if it was submitted in #digital-workplace channel at its inception), or via the Jira interface. If you need to comment on the issue in Jira, there are two options:

    1. Add internal note: Will only show the comment to fellow service desk agents. This is often used to communicate issue resolution notes or questions for other agents.

    2. Reply to customer: Will show the comment as visible to the issue’s requestor, and will also send them an email (depending on whether they’ve turned off Jira notifications to email).

  6. When you have addressed the issue in the ticket, move it from its Pending or Work in Progress status to a Closed status.

    1. You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there.

Reminder Messages

Once a week, an Okta workflow will message you in Slack if you have any outstanding Digital Workplace service desk tickets that are not closed.

Advanced Handling: Keyboard Shortcuts

If you despise clicking around on a ticket, you might enjoy utilizing the Atlassian Jira Keyboard Shortcuts. These allow you to quickly open (o), assign to someone else (a), assign to yourself (i), or add a comment (m) among other options.

children.title: Confluence Quick Search with Chrome Omnibox Search Bar
children.content:
If you have a question and need to quickly find a solution in Confluence, you can do so directly from your Google Chrome search bar (also known as the omnibox). This method allows for rapid knowledge base searches.

Instructions to Set Up Confluence Site Search

  1. Open Chrome Settings: In the corner menu of your Chrome browser, click the icon for "more options" (usually three vertical dots), then click "Settings."

  2. Navigate to Search Engine Settings: Scroll down the settings page and click "Search engine" on the left-hand sidebar navigation menu.

  3. Manage Search Engines: Click "Manage search engines and site search."

  4. Add New Site Search: Under the "Site search" section, click "Add."

  5. Enter Search Details:

    • You can choose your own search engine title (e.g., "Simplifi Confluence") and keyword (e.g., "conf", "confluence", "wiki").

    • Crucially, use this exact URL for the query string: "https://simplifi.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action?queryString=%s"

  6. Save Configuration: Click "Save."

How to Use the Confluence Quick Search

Now, when you have a question for the Simplifi knowledge base, simply:

  1. Type your chosen keyword (e.g., "conf") into your Chrome omnibox (address bar).

  2. Press the space bar. The omnibox will now recognize it as a Confluence search.

  3. Type your search query (e.g., "vpn setup" or "password reset").

  4. Press Enter to instantly search the Simplifi Confluence site.

Example for Salesforce: You could "ADD" another search engine. In this case, the URL would be:
https://na43.salesforce.com/_ui/search/ui/UnifiedSearchResults?searchType=2&sen=500&sen=005&str=%s

This feature allows you to create custom search shortcuts for any frequently used website, significantly boosting your search efficiency.

children.title: Bitwarden Guide: Access and Logging into with Okta SSO
children.content:
This document provides a comprehensive guide to Bitwarden, explaining its purpose and detailing the steps for requesting access, activating your account, accessing the application, and troubleshooting common issues.
Note: Screen shots are for representation only and may have been changed on the Bitwarden site.

What is Bitwarden

Bitwarden is a secure password manager used to securely store shared passwords and keys among teams. It provides a centralized and encrypted vault for managing sensitive credentials, enhancing security and collaboration.

I. Requesting Access to Bitwarden

The Digital Workplace team has developed an automated self-service request process for quick access to the Bitwarden platform. There are several ways listed below to initiate your Bitwarden access.

  1. Slack. (2 Options)
    Slack Option 1: Request via Slack (Okta App)

    • Search for the Okta app under "Apps" in Slack. If it's not visible, click "Add apps" and select the Okta app.

    • Under the "Home" tab of the Okta app, click "Choose a resource."

    • Select: "Bitwarden"

      Slack Option 2: Request via Slack (#digital-workplace channel command)

    1. From within the #digital-workplace Slack channel, type the following command directly into the channel (case sensitive): /access Bitwarden

    2. click continue and you will begin the same process.

    c. Add a short description why you are requesting access.
    d. Select Yes/No if your manager is available.
    - If manager is not available, the approval process goes to the Digital Workplace team.

    e. Click Submit.
    f. A Jira ticket will be generated and assigned the status of Waiting Approval.
    Once approval is obtained, proceed to Step II below to send the Activation Email and complete the setup of your account.

  2. Request from the Okta Access Request Panel
    a. Navigate to your Okta dashboard and select the tile labeled "Okta Access Request."

    b. This will open a separate console for you to request the Bitwarden app (along with many other apps)
    click the Request access and you will be prompted with same or similar steps and questions as above.

  4. Request For: Select ‘You’ and fill out questions and click Submit.
    note: You can submit a request on behalf of another user.

Step II. Activation Email

After submitting your request, please check your email for the account activation message.

  1. Click Go to vault.

  2. Enter in your email if not autofilled. Click Continue.

  3. Click the Log in Option.

Click sign-in with Enterprise single sign-on.

  1. If you are not currently logged into your Okta console, you will be prompted to authenticate using your Okta credentials.

  2. After successfully authenticating, the next step is to establish your Master Password. It is crucial to adhere to the complexity guidelines while creating this password. This Master Password works in conjunction with Okta authentication and is integrated directly into the app.

  3. Click submit.

  4. You will need to enter in your Master Password to access your vault now after .

  5. Account Confirmation: Once your account is created, the Digital Workplace team will verify it within the Bitwarden administration tenant, adding an extra layer of security.

Step III: Accessing Bitwarden the app.

You will find a Bitwarden tile on your Okta dashboard, which currently directs you to the Bitwarden login page. Once there, you will need to enter your credentials.

  1. You can also Navigate to https://vault.bitwarden.com/#/login directly.

  2. Enter your email address and continue.

  3. You can either click "Continue" or utilize "Single Sign-On." Both options will authenticate you through Okta seamlessly in the background.

  4. Once Okta Authenticates your account, you will be prompted to enter in your Master Password to get to your console.

Desktop Downloads:

  1. Bitwarden is available as a desktop application for Mac, Windows, and Linux.
    https://bitwarden.com/download/

Browser Extensions:

  1. Bitwarden is available as a browser extension for the following:

    • Google Chrome

    • Mozilla Firefox

    • Opera

    • Microsoft Edge

    • Safari

  2. The Current Browser extension integrations process can be found at:
    https://bitwarden.com/help/article/getting-started-browserext/

Troubleshooting

In the event you have created an account with your simpli.fi email address but it is NOT tied to our organization tenant. Then you will need to go through the steps to remove that account so that it can be added back into our tenant.
WARNING! if you have any saved passwords/keys/etc you will need to export this data or copy it down because it WILL BE DELETED and you will not be able to recover.
https://bitwarden.com/help/delete-your-account/

Creating new records

When creating new records in BW, you can either save them to your personal vault or a shared vault.

Browser Extension:

  1. From your browser extension, click the '+' sign in the top right

  2. Enter the following details:

    • Name: <record name>

    • Username: <username or email associated with login>

    • Password: <enter a password or generate one by clicking the icon>

    • URI: <the url of the website this record is for>

  3. Optionally, you can setup an Authenticator Key (TOTP) if you need to use MFA for this account. Clicking the camera icon will scan the QR code for you, or you can manually enter the code.

  4. IMPORTANT: scroll to the bottom and set the ownership for this record. If you need to add it to a shared collection, select ‘Simpli.fi’ and select the collection(s).

Web Page:

1. In the top right, click New > Item

  1. Follow the same instructions above
    Accessing personal records

Browser Extension:

From your browser extension, click ‘Vault’ at the bottom, then All vaults > My vault

Web Page:

Under ‘All Vaults’ on the left, select ‘My Vault’

Accessing shared records in a vault

You can use the search bar to find all records, or search through the collections:

Browser Extension:

From your browser extension, click ‘Vault’ at the bottom, then All vaults > My vault

Web Page:

Under ‘All Vaults’ on the left, select ‘My Vault’

Redeeming free Bitwarden for Families account

Bitwarden provides a complimentary family account that can be accessed through your work account. The Bitwarden for Families plan includes:

  • Premium access for up to 6 users

  • Shared collections for family secrets

To take advantage of this feature, please follow the steps outlined below:

  1. Log in to the Bitwarden web console using the link available in your Okta dashboard.

  2. In the left-side menu, select Settings > Free Bitwarden Families.

  3. Send an invitation to your personal email. (Note: If you already have an existing Bitwarden account, this will create a new ‘Organization’ under your personal account.)

children.title: Datadog Guide:
children.content: • Applications Keys & Service Accounts
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: Datadog Guide: Applications Keys & Service Accounts
children.content:
Service accounts are non-interactive accounts designed to manage application keys and other resources shared among teams.

For instance, consider a scenario where an employee creates a monitoring dashboard using their personal application key. If that employee departs from the company, their Datadog account is deactivated, rendering their application key inactive. Consequently, the monitoring dashboard will cease to function until someone updates it with a valid application key. To prevent this issue, utilizing a service account application key instead of a personal application key for automated requests to the Datadog API is highly recommended.

Note: Creating Service Accounts requires admin access.

To view / access service accounts in the UI:

  1. Navigate to Organization Settings from your account menu.

  2. Under Accounts, select Service Accounts.

Create service account

To create a service account, perform the following steps:

  1. Click New Service Account. A dialog box appears.

  2. Enter a name and email address for your service account.


    Note: This can be a Google Group email address.

  3. Use the Assign Roles dropdown menu to choose one or more roles for your service account. Custom roles can be created to ensure that the service account has only the access it needs. Find out how to create custom roles here.

  4. To save, click Create Service Account.

Unlike the email addresses for Datadog users, service account email addresses do not need to be unique across an organization.

Edit service account

To modify a service account, click on one in the service accounts list.

  1. In the side panel, click Edit next to the service account name. A dialog box appears.

  2. Update any fields you would like to change. You can edit the name, email address, status, and roles.

  3. Click Save.

To disable a service account, follow the procedure above to edit the service account and set the status to Disabled.

Create or revoke application keys

To create or revoke service account application keys, select an account from the service account list. The service account’s side panel appears.

To create a new application key, follow the steps below:

  • Click New Key. A dialog box appears.

  • Give the key a descriptive name.

  • Click Create Key.

The dialog box refreshes, showing you the key. Copy and paste the key into your desired location. After you close the dialog box, you cannot retrieve the value of the key.

To revoke an application key, locate the key in the service account detailed view side panel and hover over it. You will see pencil and trash can icons appear on the right side. Click the trash can icon to revoke the key. After revocation, click Confirm.

Note: You can view a service account application key only once, immediately after its creation. Limiting access to the application key helps prevent issues that may arise if another user gains access to it. If you lose or forget a service account key, revoke it and create a new one.

Permissions

Creating a service account allows you to establish an entity that interacts with Datadog on your behalf. The options available to you on the Service Accounts page are determined by your specific Datadog roles and permissions.

To create a service account, you must possess the Service Account Write permission. This permission is included in the Datadog Admin role, meaning that anyone with this role can create service accounts.

When setting up a service account, you have the flexibility to assign it any combination of the roles and permissions that you hold. However, if you have the User Access Manage permission, you effectively gain administrator-level access, allowing you to perform any action within Datadog. Accounts with the User Access Manage permission face no limitations regarding the roles and permissions they can assign to service accounts.

Notifications

Datadog sends a notification to the email address associated with the service account when the following actions occur:

  • Create an application key

  • Revoke an application key

  • Disable the service account

Please see the relevant policy documentation provided by our Procurement Specialist on the Business Development team: Vendor Contract Process | DocuSign CLM Contract Upload Process. If there are questions, please email procurement@simpli.fi.

Please see the relevant policy documentation provided by our Procurement Specialist on the Business Development team: Vendor Contract Process | DocuSign CLM Contract Upload Process. If there are questions, please email procurement@simpli.fi.

As noted in the rationale behind transitioning to DocuSign, and desired DocuSign functionality, Simplifi uses DocuSign Contract Lifecycle Management to ensure centralized, streamline process for any vendor contracts and client contracts.

There are thus two use cases for the DocuSign CLM:

  • Procurement of new software applications or vendors to be used at the enterprise level. This would include:

    • Contracts

    • Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreements

    • Data Processing Agreements

    • Master Service Agreements

  • Sales pipeline management

    • Insertion Orders

The former is exclusively managed within DocuSign CLM workflows, which generate tasks for approval by needed teams (Business Development, Finance, Security, Digital Workplace) and authorized departmental buyers.

The latter (sales use case) is managed through an integration with DocuSign CLM and Salesforce DocuSign App Launcher. It is specifically targeted at new insertion orders.

For more information on DocuSign CLM, please see the following technical guides (currently under construction--more to come!):

children.title: DocuSign CLM: DocuSign Edit App
children.content:
As part of DocuSign CLM, you can easily edit DocuSign documents that are Word Documents through two ways.

When viewing a document during an approval step or task, you can either:

  1. From the Edit menu, select Open document OR

  2. From the Edit menu, select Open with Office Online

If you do not want to simply open a copy in Office Online and have to re-upload it into DocuSign CLM, you can use the DocuSign Edit App by following the first step (Open document).

Instructions

  1. Once in the task and viewing the affiliated document, you can select Edit in the upper right-hand corner.

  2. From the drop-down menu, select Open document.

  3. Once you do, you will be prompted to download the Docusign Edit app if you have not previously done so.

  4. Proceed to download from the DocuSign support article, selecting the option for macOS.

  5. Follow the installation guide upon opening the DocuSignEdit.pkg on your computer.

  6. After it is installed, when you go to select the Open document, you will then be prompted to authorize your DocuSign Edit app by logging into DocuSign.

  7. Upon following the prompt to log into DocuSign, you will then have your application authorized.

These steps are only needed the first time you select the Open document option.

children.title: DocuSign Google Integration
children.content:
With the DocuSign Google Integration, you can sign documents, send documents, and take critical actions from within your everyday use of the Google Suite interface.

Please only using this integration if you have a DocuSign account through Simpli.fi. You can obtain this DocuSign account by requesting access (in the Okta Access Request portal or via Slack /access docusign shortcut.)

The DocuSign Google integration is pre-installed in your Google applications. You can utilize it by taking the actions below:

Instructions

  1. Log into your Google mail inbox via your Okta portal or by going directly to mail.google.com.

  2. On the right-hand, side navigation menu, you’ll notice that the DocuSign app has been added to your Gmail integrations.

  1. Click the DocuSign logo.

  2. Authorize the application to see relevant data in Google. by clicking the Authorize access button.

  3. Select the Simpli.fi account you’d like to authorize and click Continue.

  4. If you are comfortable with the permissions, click Allow.

  5. Click the Log In button that shows after approving access.

  6. You will be prompted to enter your Simpli.fi email.

  7. Select Use company login when prompted. Provided you have an account with us via Okta, Okta will pass your credentials and complete the integration.

  8. Once you have authorized the integration, you will be able to quickly set up any received PDF for signatures (or sign yourself).

Through this integration, you can also opt into saving important documents to your Google Drive. This will allow your team members to have access to files once constrained to the visibility of your inbox.

(For more information, check out the DocuSign marketing collateral on this feature!)

How to Use DocuSign for Sales Insertion Orders

Our Sales Department members are the primary users of e-signature platforms at Simpli.fi. We know that the adjustment from AdobeSign to DocuSign was a big change. To make life easier, please view the recording for:

Sharing Document Envelopes

If you ever need to be out of office for a time, or want another team member to consistently be able to take actions on a DocuSign envelope you manage, you can adjust your Shared Access settings.

:books:1f4da📚#DEEBFF

See DocuSign’s documentation and videos on this topic.

Signing Documents

DocuSign allows users to sign their own documents--not simply send documents to other for signature. This feature allows you to quickly upload and sign from the Home or the Agreements page.

:books:1f4da📚#DEEBFF

See DocuSign’s documentation and videos on this topic.

Adding Multiple Documents to an Envelope

Add multiple documents at a time from your local laptop or from your Google Drive account. DocuSign allows users to send multiple file types for signature by others.

:books:1f4da📚#DEEBFF

children.title: Transition from Adobe Acrobat Sign
children.content:
Decision to Consolidate to DocuSign

Effective September 1, 2024, we will be exclusively using DocuSign for all outbound, client-facing and internal document signatures. Employees can still sign documents initiated by clients or vendors through the external party’s platform of choice.

In preparation for this transition, all employees with access to Adobe Acrobat Sign will receive a DocuSign tile in their Okta Dashboard on August 19, 2024.

What does this mean for me as an Acrobat Sign user?

If you need to be able to edit PDFs frequently, you can utilize Acrobat Business Standard. We will keep this functionality available and have licenses already assigned to those who have needed it historically.

If you currently use Adobe Acrobat Sign for documents sent for electronic signatures, you will receive a direct Slack message notifying you of this change and confirming that you have been assigned a DocuSign account (complete with login instructions).

Context for the Decision

Historically, Simpli.fi has used Acrobat Sign for external documents sent to clients (insertion orders from the Sales Department primarily). It has used DocuSign for internal use cases (HR, Accounting, Legal primarily).

Over the last few months, the Digital Workplace team reviewed the following items with stakeholders invested in e-signature tool selection:

  • the user experience (access, UI design, ease of use)

  • support experience (submitting tickets, professional services)

  • administrative burden (Okta, licensing and billing model)

  • feature sets of available e-signature tools (future integrations with Salesforce and Netsuite for Contract Lifecycle Management)

As of August 2024, we have confirmed stakeholders' preference in consolidating to DocuSign as our sole e-signature platform for outbound signatures.

:question_mark:atlassian-question_mark:question_mark:#DEEBFF

More questions? Please see our additional FAQ’s related to this change.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: FAQ's: The Move to DocuSign
children.content:
16falsenonelisttrue

What does this mean for me as an Acrobat Sign user?

If you need to be able to edit PDFs frequently, you can utilize Acrobat Business Standard. We will keep this functionality available and have licenses already assigned to those who have needed it historically.

If you currently use Adobe Acrobat Sign for documents sent for electronic signatures, you will receive a direct Slack message notifying you of this change and confirming that you have been assigned a DocuSign account (complete with login instructions).

Does this impact other Adobe products?

No. Anyone who needs access to Creative Cloud products (e.g., Illustrator, PhotoShop, Acrobat Pro) will still keep these licenses.

When will this change take place?

We have access to DocuSign currently and will be adding all Adobe Users into DocuSign Okta groups starting August 19th.

When should I stop using AdobeSign?

Please stop using AdobeSign as soon as you see the DocuSign tile in your Okta dashboard (by end of day August 19th).

We will hide the AdobeSign Okta tile on August 20th so as to prevent confusion; but please also stop sending files for signature through it.

What will happen to all of my files?

You can download your Acrobat Sign files to your team’s shared Google Drive (preferable). If your team does not have a shared Google Drive, consider creating one … or save to your personal Google Drive folder.

We will additionally perform a bulk export of all files currently in Acrobat Sign from August 29th - 31st.

What about the templates I created in Adobe Acrobat Sign?

While we have the ability to export documents in bulk, and you can download your documents, Adobe does not allow people to download templates.

We can help you recreate your templates as needed. Please contact the Digital Workplace team via digitalworkplace@simpli.fi or #digital-workplace Slack channel for assistance. (You have the ability to create these templates yourselves, and to even use someone else’s template once they create it--whether via sharing the template with a group or by uploading them in bulk into DocuSign to your account).

I did not cancel my in-progress (“Out for Signature”) documents in Adobe Acrobat Sign before the transition. What can I do now?

Contact the digitalworkplace@simpli.fi or #digital-workplace Slack channel to be temporarily re-added to the Adobe SSO group in Okta. This will give you access to view your in-progress documents in Adobe Acrobat Sign. You can then follow these steps to cancel each item that was sent for signature.

Please notify the digital workplace team when you have finished your work in cancelling. You can then be removed from Adobe SSO access.

I used DocuSign before it became the company-wide default. How does the additional user base impact me and what can be seen?

By default, no one can see document envelopes unless they are the signer or sender. However, you have a couple options now to share templates with your departmental group, or share documents with users whom you approve. Please see this brief video for more information…
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Future DocuSign Functionality
children.content:
DocuSign is currently somewhat manual, wherein people upload documents or use document templates to send for signature. The user then can download to their personal or shared Google Driver folders.

One exception is for the Software Sales team that utilizes Salesforce CPQ+. This is a fully integrated solution to initiate document generation, sending, approval, and storage in Salesforce.

Beginning September 1, 2024, the Digital Workplace team is partnering with Business Solutions and Sales team stakeholders to explore options for:

  • Automations to store relevant DocuSign files in Salesforce accounts (goal for January 1, 2025)

  • Contract Lifecycle Management with DocuSign<>Salesforce (exploring functionality)

  • CPQ+ for Media Planning team (very long term goal)

The goals of these explorations are to:

  1. reduce toil for salespersons in crafting Insertion Orders,

  2. reduce turnaround time for getting signatures

  3. share relevant IOs with anyone working on the account currently or in the future

Update!

As of November 2024, we have begun the process to streamline the IO creation and sending experience with the DocuSign<>Salesforce integration (to be deployed to all Sales team members in December 2024). We are also kicking off the DocuSign Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) feature set in November 2024 to further provide visibility and automated organization of all Sales contracts.

children.content:
https://www.donut.com/

Connect around the watercooler, anywhere

Connect serendipitously for virtual coffee, peer learning, birthday and work anniversary celebrations, DEI discussions, and more.

We all need friends at work. Having authentic relationships with our colleagues makes us more productive, 7x more engaged, and increases our happiness as much as a $100,000 raise.

Over 15,000 teams like Okta, Betterment, Gitlab, Zapier, and InVision have used Donut to make 6+ million connections among teammates across departments, office locations, and continents.

Donut makes connections across the organization, for teams of all sizes in three ways: by encouraging in-person or virtual meetups, asynchronous banter, and more festive birthday and work anniversary celebrations.

How to join a Donut

  • To join the primary Engineering Donut

    • Join #engineering-watercooler to be automatically added to the Donut rotation

Donut Etiquette

  • If you are unable to regularly join and participate in donuts, consider:

    • Pausing your Donut pairing (instructions)

    • Leaving the Donut channel

  • Come ready to connect and have fun

  • Be present in your conversation

  • Be as vulnerable as possible to put the other person(s) at ease

  • Have your camera on

  • Have some icebreaker questions ready in case the conversation stalls

  • If you identify something about work you need to discuss, consider having another meeting outside the Donut to discuss further (especially if another person is on the call that the work discussion doesn’t apply to)

children.title: GitHub Enterprise
children.content:
This guide will be used for using/accessing Github and Service Account usage in Github.

GitHub Account

To gain access into Simplifi’s github organization, you will need to already have a Github account in place.
Digital Workplace doesnt typically handle the creation of the actual Github account, only the access that is needed once the account is in place.
This is because a high majority of users already have an account and we can easily assign / unassign access with those accounts. If you already have a Github account, Skip to Step 3 in the Create an account section.

Create an Account.

  1. If we assist in the account creation, typically we recommend using this format.
    firstNameLastName-simpli and use your current simplifi email address.

  2. Once you have created your personal account, you have to enable 2FA to your account. Typically, this is done with Google Authenticator.
    (This account access is separate from Okta, because this is technically a ‘personal’ account into Github itself)

  3. Once you have your account setup, you need to request access through the Okta access request system.
    https://simplifi.atlassian.net/l/cp/juu4yF42

  4. You should receive an invite that will add your user account to the Simplifi Github Organization.

Accessing Simplifi’s GitHub Org.

Under your profile you should see in your organizations the green Simplifi logo.

To gain access into this org, you WILL be required to authenticate with your Okta credentials.
If you receive an error, or a message informing you that you hve not been assigned this application, please go through the access request option above in Step 3.

Service Account Access

Service account access works the same way as a personal account access would.
- Log in to the Github account with 2FA to authenticate against GitHubs tenant.
- Authenticate against Okta to gain access into our Simplifi Organization.

Steps to log in with a SA.

  1. You will need to have Bitwarden access with access to the Github and/or Infrastructure vaults.

  2. If you do not have access to Bitwarden, please refer to Step 3 from above to request access.

  3. In the vault, you should see the Github account information that logs you into Github itself.

    Here you will have the username/pw and Authentication Code(TOTP) to get logged in.

  4. Once logged into Github, you will also have to authenticate with Okta to get into the Org.
    These typically have the Github-Okta naming convention as shown below.

    This will give you the same information as above to get authenticated via Okta.
    username/password and Authentication Code(TOTP)

ReAuthenticating Personal account keys with SAML.

If you have created any personal account keys, whether its your own account or a service account. You will need to resynch your keys to the new SAML login. This information can be located here in Githubs documentation.
https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/authentication/authenticating-with-saml-single-sign-on/authorizing-a-personal-access-token-for-use-with-saml-single-sign-on

SSH Keys
https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/authentication/authenticating-wit[…]gn-on/authorizing-an-ssh-key-for-use-with-saml-single-sign-on

Administration:

To remove an external user from GitHub, follow these steps:

  1. Click on the three dots next to the Outside Collaborator.

  2. Remove the external user from all repositories associated with your GitHub account.
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: 2FA for Service Accounts in GitHub
children.content:
How to enable 2FA (aka MFA) for service accounts in GitHub.

  1. Login to GitHub using the credentials in Bitwarden.

  2. Click the avatar in the upper right corner and click Settings

  3. Click Password and authentication

  4. Click to enable two factor authentication

  5. Under Setup authenticator app, click setup key

  6. Copy/paste the setup key into the TOTP field in Bitwarden for the service account. Then Bitwarden will automatically create the authentication code to be pasted in GitHub.

  7. Click to download recovery codes

Need more details: GitHub 2FA Documentation

children.title: Apple vs. Microsoft vs. Google
children.content:
You may have noticed that, depending on your team, you have varying access or preferences regarding the use of core applications (for things like word processing, number crunching, presentation design, and even… email.)

Why is that?

16falsedefaultlistfalse

HISTORICAL CONTEXT

From its inception, Simpli.fi was an Apple-only company in terms of devices. And with Apple Macbook devices came things like Numbers, Pages, Keynote, and Apple Mail. Because these are not standard programs utilized by our clients and vendors, it made sense to have more flexible file formats and compatibility. Simpli.fi thus also had limited licenses for Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, Teams.) To remain lean, Simpli.fi experimented with a select number having those applications (based on departmental needs), and tried the open source LibreOffice for all others.

Through all of this, Simpli.fi’s email provider was Google. And with Google Enterprise accounts came access to Sheets, Drive, Docs, Forms, Slides, etc. Google became a great equalizer as it allowed export to formats accepted by Microsoft Office applications of our clients, while allowing us to collaborate internally in the same SaaS solution. (And to be fair, who doesn’t prefer Google Sheets to Apple Numbers?)

Over time, Simpli.fi has grown to acquire companies (and their clients) who primarily utilize PC devices and Microsoft applications (e.g., Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel). While these team members continue to use PC devices, we are working as a company to utilize a shared solution in Google Suite. In large part, this is due to the fact that Google Workplace holds our directory of users email accounts and groups.

SO WHAT ABOUT NOW?

Each of these product suites has their advantages, but also have high overlap in functionality. To reduce (1) licensing waste and (2) toil in file compatibility / reformatting, we recommend utilizing Google Suite applications wherever possible.

There will be some use cases where Excel is required, for example, by the accounting team. And we acknowledge that some clients simply won’t use Slack to communicate with us (okay, Microsoft Teams it is…). But for the most part, we root for Google Suite (“G-Suite”) options, in no small part due to their:

  • simultaneous, real-time editing,

  • integrated chat collaboration,

  • team groups integrations with Google Calendar, Gmail and Drive,

  • heightened scripting/add-on options for further customization and automation, and

  • integrations with Slack and Slack Workflow Builder

If you’re needing some assistance getting Google Suite applications to work like Microsoft Office applications (or otherwise make a case for needing one over the other), consider these resources:

FURTHER READING & RECOMMENDATIONS

  • Google Sheets vs. Excel: Which is right for you? (Zapier Blog, 2024)

  • Google Slides vs. Keynote vs. PowerPoint (SourceForge, current)

  • Google Workspace vs Office 365: An 8-Point Comparison (CLOUDALLY, 2024)

  • 5 Reasons to switch from Microsoft Office to Google Workspace (PCWorld, 2023)

  • Google Workspace vs. Microsoft 365 (COMPUTERWORLD, 2022)

  • How to make Google Drive apps look and work more like Microsoft Office (PCWorld, 2016)

WHAT ABOUT CURRENT EXCEPTIONS?

Microsoft Teams

If a client insists that they cannot use Zoom or Google Meet, you are still able to join a Microsoft Teams meeting they host with a free account. If you need to be able to host a teams meeting, or even chat with clients in Microsoft teams, you can submit a request in the Okta Access Request Portal contact the #digital-workplace. Currently, any requester who is not already in the pre-approved Sales team exceptions will have to be reviewed by senior leadership.

Microsoft Office

If you require Microsoft Office and do not currently have the relevant applications on your machine, please send explanation to #digital-workplace Slack channel or digitalworkplace@simpli.fi.

The Digital Workplace team is required to help you first discover if your need can be satisfied by existing options in G-Suite. Help us help you (and your coworkers) by identifying needs that we can either better document or troubleshoot.

If you happen to have Microsoft Office applications locally on your work laptop, you might notice that they are showing an alert about updates. Our current, limited access to Microsoft 2019 licenses are constrained by their pending termination of support (October 2025). We are discussing options whether to renew static licenses or

WHAT ABOUT FUTURE DEMANDS?

The Digital Workplace team is aware that the current licensing structure for Microsoft Office access is not ideal. It’s a headache for administrators to manually manage static license keys; and users cannot easily access online versions of Microsoft Office and choose to update/download locally.

We are currently petitioning senior leadership for the option to provide M365 licenses as needed. But our success in getting such a change approved hinges on helping users find options for their needs within G-Suite first. If you believe you have a good case for Microsoft Office access, please don’t hesitate to share with digitalworkplace@simpli.fi.

children.title: Customizing Your Inbox: Date Ranges
children.content:
If you’d like to have your Gmail inbox operating more like Outlook or Yahoo (where emails are grouped by custom date ranges), look no further than the Multiple Inbox functionality.

Instructions

  1. Login to your Gmail account in your web browser of choice.

  2. Select the in the upper, right-hand corner of your inbox.

  3. Select the See all settings from the right-hand side panel that appears.

  4. Once within all settings, click Inbox.

  5. Select Multiple Inbox from within the Inbox type drop-down menu.

  6. Within the custom query section, place your parameters thus:

  1. In the Multiple inbox position option, select where you want to see these subdividers appear. (You’d like prefer to see them above your aggregated inbox, but can also select to place them below or to the right of your aggregated inbox).

  2. When finished, scroll to the bottom of the settings and click Save Changes

You can use this customization for any query that supports how you like to do work--not just date ranges. Need to be able to quickly view things from certain people? Change the search query and section name accordingly. For more information on your options, check out Google’s query documentation.

children.title: Create a Google Calendar for a Group
children.content:
Say you’d like to have a team calendar for team events, or a specific calendar based on theme (like new hire start dates and anniversaries), please see the instructions below to meet your needs.

none

Instructions: Create a Calendar

If you’d like to create a calendar that is not your personal calendar, please take the following steps…

  1. Open Google Calendar.

  2. On the left-hand side navigation menu, identify Other calendars.

  3. Click the to select the option to Create new calendar.

  4. You will be redirected to create a calendar:

    1. Add the name of the calendar (for example, Capybara Team Calendar),

    2. Add a description, and

    3. Add a default time zone.

  5. Click Create calendar.

Instructions: Share Your Calendar

If you don’t want to be the sole owner of the calendar (especially in situations where you want a calendar to outlast your time with Simpli.fi), please share with other users and/or groups.

  1. Open Google Calendar.

  2. On the left-hand side navigation menu, click the name of your newly created calendar (above) or existing calendar you wish to share.

  3. Click the vertical ellipses next to the calendar to select Settings and Sharing.

  4. Once redirected into the calendar’s settings, scroll to the section labeled Access permissions for events.

    1. Ensure that you have checked the option to Make Available for Simpli.fi to “See all event details” if you want anyone at Simpli.fi to be able to subscribe to the calendar.

  5. If you’d prefer to only share with a couple people/specific groups, scroll to Share with specific people or groups.

    1. Click + Add people and groups.

    2. Select the Google group alias or individual email of the user.

    3. By each user or group, click the Down arrow to choose an option.

    4. Click Send.

Connecting Your Group Calendar to Slack

Slack used to have a Google Calendar for Teams Slack application that has since been deprecated. However, they have been working to add this functionality to their Google Calendar application. They state that theoretically, someone could connect a team calendar to a Slack channel by following their process for adding personal calendars to a Slack Channel.

Please see Slack documentation for the most up-to-date status of this feature.

Individual Calendar Events Transfer

Through Google Workspace Administration and GAM command line, the Digital Workplace team has the ability to transfer calendar event ownership at a per-event or per-user level.

Whenever an employee transitions from Simpli.fi, the Digital Workplace team automatically transfers ownership of their calendar events to their manager.

And should another user (not their manager) need to own a former employee’s calendar (or even just one of their events), we have the ability to honor that request in the #digital-workplace Slack Channel.

children.title: ✉️ Gmail Signature Disappeared? Here's a Quick Fix!
children.content:
🧩 What's Happening?

Some users have noticed that their email signature disappeared from Gmail. This is related to an ongoing subscription issue within the Gmail system.

While that’s being resolved, here’s a simple workaround to get your signature back quickly!

🛠️ Step-by-Step Fix

1. Open Gmail in Chrome

Click the ⚙️ gear icon in the top-right corner of Gmail.

2. Click See all settings

Once the menu opens, click "See all settings" at the top.

3. Scroll to the "Signature" Section

  • Click + Create new to make a new signature.

  • Paste your previous signature if you have one from an old email.

4. Set the Signature as Default

Under the same section:

  • For new emails use: Select your new signature

  • On reply/forward use: Select your new signature again

and You’re all Done!

Just Some Reminders

  • Clearing cache doesn’t resolve this issue.

  • This method works in Gmail on Google Chrome.

  • If you lost your signature, copy it from a previously sent email!

Still Skeptical? This is what the team said 👥

“Mine is good to go now. Thank you!” — Ryan H.

“I’m all set as well, thanks!” — Rachel P.

Are you Still stuck? Feel free to reach out to #digital-workplace if you are still having this issue, we are happy to help 😊

children.title: LiveRamp
children.content:
Simpli.fi uses Liveramp to manage audiences for clients. At this time, Client Success and Sales team members may request access.

Historically, for the Client Success team and for the Sales team, reviewed these requests. So that the requests are not dependent on the availability of these two employees, the Digital Workplace team can assist with requests for access.

Instructions

  1. If you need access to LiveRamp Connect, you can request it via:

    1. The Okta Access Requests Portal’s LiveRamp Connect Request Type

    2. Using the /access liveramp command in a Slack message box

    3. Reaching out in #digital-workplace with your request.

  2. Once you submit your request, your email address will be immediately added to the Okta LiveRamp Connect application group. This will allow you to see the LiveRamp Connect tile.

  3. Even if you see the tile, there is an additional action required by the Digital Workplace team to add you in LiveRamp. The Okta Support Slack app or the Digital Workplace employee connecting with you will notify when complete.

  4. To log into it in the future, you can either select the Okta LiveRamp tile, use the Okta Chrome extension, or go to LiveRamp’s site and let Okta pass your credentials for you.

If you are a Digital Workplace employee, please see the Administrator’s guide on next steps.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Looker
children.content:
Introduction

We use Looker to visualize data. At this time, Looker is also integrated with the Simpli.fi App via the Report Center.

Simpli.fi is utilizes a hosted Looker solution (cloud-based). The instructions below are for Simpli.fi Looker.

Currently, the BidTellect Simpli.fi team hosts their own Looker solution on premises; it is accessible via VPN. If you are part of the legacy Bidtellect team, you would access Bidtellect Looker via Cisco VPN. If you are not, you would access Bidtellect Looker via Perimeter 81 VPN.

Access

  1. Login to your Okta portal

  2. Click the Looker (Simpli.fi) tile.

  1. Authorize your account via Google when prompted.

Troubleshooting

If you’re encountering issues logging into Looker, you may be using the same browser window for the App’s Report Center and entering Looker. Technically, there are two Looker users for each person (one for the App Report Center and the Looker site proper). If you’re using the same browser, when you go from the App to Looker proper, it attempts to use your App user (which won’t have access to Looker).

If you didn’t follow the steps above to log in from your Okta portal, try going directly to looker.simpli.fi/login and it should prompt you to sign in via Google. This will utilize single sign-on to permit you access.

:bulb:1f4a1💡#DEEBFF

If you ever happen to need both for some reason, opening them in private (incognito) browser sessions will let you view both at the same time.

If you have any issues, please reach out in the #digital-workplace Slack channel for assistance.

Resources

  • Simplifi CS Looker Documentation

  • Bidtellect AdOps Looker Documentation

  • Simplifi AdOps Looker Documentation

  • Looker Cloud Documentation
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Accessing Bidtellect Looker
children.content:
The Bidtellect Simpli.fi team hosts their own Looker solution on premises. Because it is an application protected by VPN access, we advise the following steps for Simpli.fi employees when utilizing:

33falselistfalse

Log into Okta

When in doubt about how best to access company tools, think Okta as the origin. Follow these steps to log into Okta if doing so for the first time.

:bulb:1f4a1💡#DEEBFF

Remember to setup your authenticators (we recommend the Okta Verify app) and utilize the Okta Browser Plugin for seamless, secure access.


Access P81

If you do not see the Perimeter81 tile in your Okta dashboard, you can request access by either visiting the Okta Access Request tile in your Okta portal, Slacking the #digital-workplace team, or typing /access Perimeter 81 in a Slack message to automatically submit a request for access to BT_Tools

Once you’re logged into Okta, you can access P81 either from your:

Browser Application Portal Tile

Note: Your tile may be in a different location in your portal. I’ve divided my tiles along custom categories. You, too, can alter your portal tile arrangement to suit your needs. If you do not have P81 showing at all, submit a request here.

Browser Plugin

Note: Again, your browser extension may look slightly different as I have organized my apps in a custom way. The browser extension mirrors your created portal tile sections.

Access Bidtellect Looker via Perimeter 81

When clicking on the P81 tile in Okta for the first time, you will be prompted to download the Okta application. If for some reason you are not prompted, you can download the desktop agent here.

Note, if it prompts you for the workspace URL, this would be simplifi (e.g., simplifi.perimter81.com).


It is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED that you install the P81 agent on your Macbook. This will help you to stay connected to the VPN for longer periods of time.

Once you go through the steps to download the P81 agent, you may receive a window about the System Extension Blocked. If you receive this alert, you MUST approve the security settings to allow it access. Otherwise, it will not function. If you do not receive this window, you should be set to login to Bidtellect Looker. But you can always go to your System Settings and look at your Privacy & Security section.

Allow Access…

You should be able to access Bidtellect Looker once you have logged into Perimeter 81 (P81) and have been added to the BT_Tools group. You’ll simply open looker.bidtellect.com in the browser window of your choice, log in with your Looker credentials, and voila!

Here is a sample walk-through of an employee logging into P81 and Bidtellect Looker for the first time after receiving the application in Okta.

If you do not have password credentials for Bidtellect Looker, ask your team if a shared login is available. Otherwise please contact . The video below states Jason Taylor, but that is an error.

Troubleshooting

If you need further assistance on how to use Bidtellect’s Looker solution, please see these helpful notes within the Bidtellect Confluence Space. Additionally, don’t hesitate to contact the #digital-workplace team with any issues.

Some Simpli.fi Mac users have found they cannot access Bidtellect Looker through P81 VPN if they are not running the most up to date operating system. Please ensure you have the most recent MacOS. And if you encounter issues with this particular error, please contact the facilities team.

children.title: Microsoft Office 365 2-Factor Authentication
children.content:
1. Go to Office 365 Login Page:

    • Open your web browser and navigate to the Office 365 login page (https://portal.office.com).

  2. Enter Your Email:

    • Enter your Simplifi email address and click "Next."

  3. Enter Your Okta Password:

    • You will be redirected to the Okta login page.

    • Enter your Okta password and click "Sign In."

  4. Authenticate with Okta Verify:

    • You will be prompted to authenticate using Okta Verify.

    • Open the Okta Verify app on your mobile device.

    • Approve the login request via Touch ID / Fingerprint or by entering the code displayed in the Okta Verify app.

  5. Phone Verification:

    • If additional verification is needed, Okta will send a push notification or SMS to your phone.

    • Approve the login request via the push notification or enter the code received via SMS.

Finalize Setup

  1. Complete Profile Information:

    • Complete any additional profile information required by Simplifi

  2. Access Office 365:

    • Once authenticated, you will be granted access to Office 365.

Desktop App Sign In

  1. Click the sign in option in any of the Microsoft Desktop Apps.

  2. When prompted with the Okta sign in page, ebter your credentials and password.

  3. When prompted for MFA, FastPass and/or touchID will NOT work.

  4. You may need to click the 'Verify with something else link.

  5. This should give you other MFA options like Okta Verify or Google Authenticator for your phone.

  6. Once you are logged into the desktop app, you will not be prompted again to authenticate.

Troubleshooting Tips

  • Ensure App Permissions: Make sure Okta Verify has the necessary permissions on your phone (camera access for QR scanning, push notifications for approval requests).

  • Keep Information Updated: Regularly update your phone number and other contact information in Okta to avoid issues with authentication.

  • Contact IT Support: If you encounter any issues, you are welcome to contact the Digital Workplace team in our Slack channel or service desk (see: https://simplifi.atlassian.net/wiki/x/B4CUBAE )
