children.title: Intune Enrollment - End User Guide - Win 11 - Register
children.content:
Admin Only: (these instructions are for registering with Intune, not AAD joined)

This guide will provide step by step instructions for registering your Windows laptop with Intune.

Intune is our laptop management solution that will allow us to remotely manage your device when we transition to a fully remote environment. If you have any questions or concerns about this process, please reach out to the #digital-workplace channel.

What Intune is not
Intune is not a security application nor is it any type of tracking ‘Big Brother’ type of application. It is used as an inventory management system that allows Simplifi to better support end users while also being able to submit any required audit reports needed by 3rd party auditors.

It is very important that each step is followed exactly as described. If you get stuck at any point, please reach out to #digital-workplace for help.

Approx. Time to Complete: ~ 5-10 minutes

Prerequisites

1. Okta account activated and Microsoft Intune license assigned.
   You are assigned Microsoft if you see the app in your Okta Dashboard.

note: this is not a full package Microsoft license with Office products.

  1. Updated W10/11 laptop.

             Windows 10 Version 1607 or later
                        navigate to Settings -> System -> About to verify what version you are running

               Windows 11 any version

Part 1: Sign into your Simpli.fi Microsoft account in settings

  1. Save your current work before continuing (any open documents or web pages)

  2. Navigate to your start menu, and search ‘Access Work or School’

  3. In the Access Work or School menu, click ‘Connect’

  4. In the Email Address box, enter your Simpli.fi email address and click ‘Next’

  5. Next, you will be prompted to sign into Okta.

    1. Okta will prompt you to verify your account with your chosen sign in method. If you need assistance with this portion, please see How To Use Okta or reach out to #digital-workplace.

      Click Yes

  6. Once you have signed into your account with Okta, your machine will take 1-2 minutes to register. Please ensure you give your machine ample time to complete this step before moving on.

  7. You are done!

children.title: How to join a Teams meeting
children.content:
So you have a client or external party that sent you a meeting but it’s being hosted on Teams? No worries, you can still attend this meeting without a license or signing into Microsoft.

:info:atlassian-info#FFFAE6

Limitations of Free Teams:

  • You cannot chat (instant message) other people

  • You cannot host or create the meeting

  1. You will receive an email or web link invitation to join the Teams meeting from the external party. Click the link or paste it in your browser to access the meeting at the scheduled time.

    If you do not have a link to join the meeting, reach out to the customer or external party.

    If you are wanting to be the host, create the meeting over Zoom.

  2. Click Continue on this browser

  3. Accept the popup to ‘Allow’ or ‘Always Allow’ MS teams to access your microphone and camera. If you do not see the popup, click on the little camera icon in the upper right hand corner of your browser bar

  4. Enter your name in the top bar to Join as a guest

  5. You may need to be accepted or approved by the host of the meeting

children.title: 🛠 Microsoft Office for Mac – Quick Setup & Fixes
children.content:
Last updated: April 2025

Hey there! If Microsoft Office is giving you trouble, start here. Whether you're setting it up for the first time or running into issues, we've got your back.

*BEFORE TRYING ANY STEP, SAVE YOUR PROGRESS*

✅ First Things First: How to Install Office the Right Way

Let’s make sure you’re on the latest version.

  1. Open Okta

  2. Click the Office 365 tile

  1. In the top-right, click Install and more

  1. Choose Install Microsoft 365 Apps

From there just Install Office!

*Common Issues*

If you get this error:

Let the #Digital-workplace team know so we make sure you have the right access to your account

Now you’re ready to install and sign in with your Simplifi email!

👉 Use your full email + password (FastPass won’t work here)

🚑 Common Fixes (Fast + Friendly)

🧱 Stuck on “Browser Not Supported”?

No worries! This means you do not have a license to that supports the Microsoft Office!

Reach out to #digital-workplace to confirm your license is showing for your account.

Once Confirmed

  • Quit the app

  • Sign back in!

👉 Use your full email + password (FastPass won’t work here)

🔄 Apps Not Updating?

Your Using an Older Microsoft License Account That Has Had Its Last Days!

Here’s a quick refresh:

  • Delete Microsoft AutoUpdate and your Office apps

  • Reinstall fresh from Microsoft Office Using How to Install Office the Right Way

  • Open your apps and let them update

You should be good to go!

🔒 Can’t Edit? Says “View Only”?

This just means your license needs a little nudge.

  • Open Excel

  • Click The Excel Tab in the top left corner of your Navigation, Next to the apple logo

  • About Excel

  • More Info

  • Refresh License

This has been a on going issue, so every case is different!

Reach out to #digital-workplace if this doesn’t fix your issue

🧾 File Locked or Not Opening?

❌ Can’t Save?

Let’s fix that:

  • Quit Excel completely (Force Quit if needed)

  • Wait until it fully closes

  • Try opening the file again

  • Still no luck? Move the file to your Desktop and try again

💬 Still need a hand?

Send us a message on the #digital-workplace slack channel & tell us where you're stuck!

children.title: Miro Board Role Groups - What are they and why do they matter?
children.content:
https://miro.com/app/live-embed/uXjVPRh2WCI=/?boardAccessToken=tVBbannaLXCVcochw8KK8xBC0jzyjOob&autoplay=true&embedMode=view_only_without_ui


This board provides a visual representation of the functional roles throughout our organization. A role refers to a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual. It helps us understand the organizational structure and responsibilities within our company. By visualizing the hierarchy and relationships between roles, we aim to foster a more efficient and effective work environment.

Purpose and Significance

The primary purpose of this Miro board is to provide a clear overview of our company's functional roles, enabling better collaboration and understanding across different teams and departments.

Our company's functional roles are organized using a bottom-up approach, where the lowest point in the hierarchy comes first. The hierarchy is structured as follows:

  1. Roles: a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual

  2. Teams: Cross-functional teams, or sub-teams operating within the departments.

  3. Value Streams: Sub departments within Engineering.

  4. Departments: Situated under each division, representing specific functional areas within the divisions.

  5. Divisions: The highest level of the hierarchy, representing the five main divisions in our company:

    • Administration

    • Marketing

    • Client Services

    • Engineering

    • Sales

  1. Roles: a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual

  2. Sub Teams: Org Level 4

  3. Teams/Value Streams: Org Level 3

  4. Sub Departments: Org Level 2

  5. Departments: Org Level 1 - The highest level of the hierarchy, representing the five main departments in our company:

    • Administration

    • Marketing

    • Client Services

    • Engineering

    • Sales

Naming Scheme Explanation

We use a consistent naming scheme for each group to make identification and understanding easier. The naming scheme follows this format:

  1. Role: <role-name>_<team-name>_role

  2. Sub Team: <sub-team-name>_<team-name>_subteam

  3. Team: <team-name>_<sub-department-name>_team (or <team-name>_<vs-name>_team for value streams)

  4. Value Stream: <vs-name>_<sub-department-name>_vs

  5. Sub Department: <sub-department-name>_<department-name>_subdept

  6. Division: <department-name>_dept

Why Use This Group Structure?

Rather than assigning individual permissions to each user (which is considered bad practice), we can assign permissions based on the person's 'role'. These roles allow us to easily manage permissions for individuals by assigning a few groups, rather than configuring permissions across hundreds of applications. This streamlined approach enhances security, simplifies access management, and reduces the risk of errors.

Moreover, with this group structure, any new hire coming into their position already has all the permissions they will need on day one. This eliminates delays in granting access and ensures employees can start being productive right away. This method also ensures that when an employee leaves the company, their access is removed immediately when the groups are unassigned from their profile.

Example Scenario

Let's illustrate the naming scheme with a few examples:

Sales Director on the Northeast Sales Team

  • Role: salesdirector_sales-northeast_role

  • Team: northeast_sales-direct_team

  • Sub Department: directagency_sales_subdept

  • Department: sales_dept

Database Engineer on the Ocelots Infrastructure Team

  • Role: dba_infra-ocelots_role

  • Sub Team: ocelots_infrastructure_subteam

  • Team/Value Stream: infrastructure_development_vs

  • Sub Department: development_engineering_subdept

  • Departmetn: engineering_dept

children.title: Dependency Mapping with Jira Data in Miro
children.content:
Set linkage in Jira (blocks, is blocked by, etc…)

Bring children of the Epic into Miro

  1. Open Epic

  2. Next to your list of Child issues, click the Action Icon (…) and select View in search

Step 2

  1. Highlight and copy (command + c) the JQL

Step 3

  1. Open the Miro Board you intend to manage dependencies in

  2. On the left toolbar, click + (Add app) & search for and select Jira Cards

Step 5

  1. In the Jira Cards App, paste (command + v) the JQL; ensure the Advanced Search is toggled On; select all issues by selecting the top check box; and click Add to import the Jira cards to the Miro board

Tip: If you have more than 10 Issues in your list, be sure to scroll to the bottom of the screen to ensure all Issues populate BEFORE selecting all

Step 6

Step 6 Result: Jira Cards Populated in Miro

Enable Dependencies in Miro

children.title: Navan (TripActions)
children.content:
We use Navan (formerly TripActions) to manage payment for work-related tools and trips. It can also be utilized for personal trip reward programs. Here are some cases in which you’d likely access Navan:

Main Menu of Products

  • You’re booking airfare and hotel for a work-related, manager-approved conference event.

  • You’re obtaining a payment method for an ongoing charge related to a work-related tool.

  • You’re needing to increase the balance on an existing “ghost card” as a work-related tool has increased its costs or licenses.

  • You’re a Simpli.fi salesperson who wants to ensure you’re utilizing your company card for client outings.

Now that you understand some of its basic uses, here are some steps you can take in each case…

22falselistfalse

Steps for Logging In

Navan Tile Image

  1. Log into your Okta Portal

    1. See these instructions if logging in for the first time.

    2. See these instructions if you

  2. Once logged into the Okta Portal, click on the Navan tile.

  3. This will redirect you to the Navan tool’s homepage.

Steps for Booking Airfare Travel

Toggle for Travel Type

Checkout Purpose Field

Trips Management

  1. While on the Navan homepage, ensure that you are searching for Business Travel.

    1. If using for Personal Travel, these steps will be similar; but without managerial approvals for out of bound expenses.

  2. Enter your travel dates for flight booking.

  3. Click Search.

  4. For each leg of the trip, click your preferred departure time.

  5. Select Standard (Economy or Economy Fully Refundable) class option, or options in the pre-approved price range.

  6. At checkout, note the Trip Purpose. (You will also have the option to change the name of the trip for your own tracking purposes).

  7. Click Save Trip Info when done.

  8. Review the cancellation policy and click Continue.

  9. Share your contact info with the airline and click Continue.

  10. Add any traveler rewards program details you have, and click Continue (or Skip if not applicable).

  11. Confirm the correct Payment method. (If Personal Travel, the corporate card option is not available).

  12. Once you have reviewed everything, click Pay.

  13. You will be able to see and manage (even cancel) your trip from within the Trips section of the tool.

Steps for Booking Hotel

Toggle for Travel Type

Policy and Rewards Alerts

Sample Room

Booking Purpose Field

  1. While on the Navan homepage, ensure that you are searching for Business Travel.

    1. If using for Personal Travel, these steps will be similar; but without managerial approvals for out of bound expenses.

  2. Enter your travel dates for the hotel booking.

  3. Click Search.

  4. Click on the hotel’s name to begin booking with the hotel you have chosen.

    1. Note: The company-policy dictates that anything above $500 per night is not covered/would need outside approval.

    2. If you select a hotel that is beneath the fair market price, you can obtain the difference by way of Amazon gift card or rewards for future trip bookings.

  5. When redirected to the hotel’s page, click Select a Room.

  6. Filter the results based on your needs.

  7. Once you have identified a room, click Select.

  8. At the Review your booking screen, note the Trip Purpose. (You will also have the option to change the name of the trip for your own tracking purposes).

  9. Click Save Trip Info when done.

  10. Review the cancellation policy and click Continue.

  11. Share your contact info with the airline and click Continue.

  12. Add any traveler rewards program details you have, and click Continue (or Skip if not applicable).

  13. Confirm the correct Payment method. (If Personal Travel, the corporate card option is not available).

  14. Once you have reviewed everything, click Pay.

  15. As with airfare and other booking details, you will be able to see, manage, and even cancel your hotel from within the Trips section of the tool.

Steps for Obtaining a New Payment Method

Monitor Purchase Cards

Details of Request

  1. While on the Navan homepage, click Navan Expenses to be redirected to the Expense center.

  2. In the top menu, select Cards.

  3. If you do not have an existing card and need one, you can submit a Request to do so by clicking Request Purchase card.

  4. Enter the relevant information for explanation of your purchase card request.

  5. Click Request purchase card.

  6. You can identify the status of your requests in the Cards section of the tool.

  7. If you have questions about your request, please contact Chris Wehring, the “Navan Savant” on our accounting team.

Steps for Increasing a Current Payment Method’s Balance

Sample Card for Tool

  1. While on the Navan homepage, click Navan Expenses to be redirected to the Expense center.

  2. In the top menu, select Cards.

  3. Identify the Purchase Card you need increased.

  4. Select the relevant card to view payment details.

  5. Provide the following information to Chris Wehring via email or direct message in Slack:

    1. The last four digits of the card

    2. The name of the card (e.g., “Travis CI”)

    3. The balance increase you are requesting

    4. The rationale for the increase

  6. Chris Wehring or other Accounting team members will confirm when increased.

children.title: Okta
children.content:
:wave:1f44b👋#DEEBFF

Hi, there!

Simpli.fi uses Okta to not only enhance application security, but also to streamline application login processes.

In our pursuit of a password-less reality, we use Okta to prepare for a future in which users can log into their work computer and automatically be logged into all applications for their workday. As we travel toward that ideal, the Digital Workplace team is here to share knowledge, answer questions, and address buggy behaviors…

← Visit Your Okta Portal

true0trueh3simple0
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Initial Setup
children.content:
:pencil2:270f✏️#DEEBFF

NOTE: This page was made public so that new employees can discover what to expect before they have logged into Okta (and therefore Confluence) for the first time.

What is Okta?

Okta is an identity and access management platform that allows you to use one password for all your applications with an extra layer of security using multi-factor authentication. Okta is the front door to all your applications. Once you’re in, you’ll see a custom dashboard tailored to have all the applications IT has assigned to you. Click on one and you’re automatically logged in. No need to re-enter any credentials.

1. Account Setup

You should receive an email from Okta with the subject line “[ACTION REQUIRED] Hello from the Simpli.fi Digital Workplace Team!”. This email expires after 7 days, so if you need to have it resent to your mailbox please reach out to the #digital-workplace Slack channel or email digitalworkplace@simpli.fi.

After you click ‘Activate Okta Account’, it will open your web browser and ask you to set your password.

2. Authenticators at Setup

After you set your password and log into your machine, you will be prompted to setup a second authentication method. Only one is required, but it is highly recommended to have multiple.

Okta Fastpass (Most Recommended)

The preferred Simpli.fi authenticator. Fastpass uses a combination of your TouchID and a local device verification to log you in. This is the easiest method out of the 4 options for logging into your applications.

How do I setup Okta Verify?

  1. Ensure you have your fingerprint enrolled in your laptop’s TouchID settings ( > System Settings > TouchID)

  2. Click ‘Sign in with Okta FastPass’ (you may have to click it twice)

  3. Okta Verify on your machine will open up. Click ‘Add Account’

    1. if you do not have Okta Verify on your machine, download and install it

  4. Your default web browser will launch and display the Okta login page. Enter your Okta username and click 'Next'. Follow the prompts to sign into your Okta account.

  5. After successfully signing in, Okta Verify will open again and prompt you to add your Touch ID with Okta Verify. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete this process.

Okta Verify Mobile App (Recommended)

A mobile app that Okta sends a push notification to your phone for you to accept or deny. Okta Verify does not collect information or grant us any access to your personal cell phone data. For more information about what this app does and does not do, please see here: Authentication Methods or reach out to the #digital-workplace team.

How do I setup Okta Verify?

  1. Download the Okta Verify app from your app store.

  2. When prompted to setup a verification method, select ‘Okta Verify’

  3. Open the Okta Verify app on your phone

  4. Click the ‘+' sign in the upper right hand corner, select ‘Organization’, then 'Yes, Ready to Scan’

  5. Scan the QR code on your computer screen

  6. Click ‘Enable’

  7. Done!

 

Biometric Login (Required for Mac)

If you are using a Mac, you most likely have a fingerprint reader located at the top right. Using your fingerprint allows you to sign into your applications extremely quickly with just the tap of your finger. However, if you choose this method, it is highly recommended to setup a second authentication method, such as Okta Verify to prevent account lock outs in the event you change computers.

How do I setup biometric login?

  1. When prompted to setup an authentication method, select ‘Security Key or Biometric Authenticator’

  2. When prompted to setup a security key, click ‘Continue’

  3. Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader

  4. Done!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Google Authenticator (Not Recommended)

This option you may have already used with previous applications at simpli.fi. It may be a little more cumbersome to use than the above two methods, but it is just as safe and secure. Google authenticator generates a six-digit code you will type into Okta to sign in.

How do I setup Google Authenticator?

  1. Download the Google Authenticator app from the app store.

  2. When prompted to choose your authentication method, select ‘Google Authenticator’

  3. Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone

  4. Within the app, press the rainbow plus sign button in the bottom right hand corner, then select ‘Scan QR code’

  5. Scan the QR code with your phone

  6. Click ‘Next’ on your computer

  7. Enter the code listed under ‘login.simpli.fi’ on your Google authenticator app

  8. Done!

 

 

 

Finishing Up

Once you complete the authenticator setup, you should be led to your end user dashboard or prompted to sign in. Since you are already signed into Okta, you will not need to sign in again to your other apps and can click on them from the dashboard.

After you’ve setup these main authenticators, we advise that you also set up Okta Fast Pass through the security methods management in Okta.


We highly recommend installing the Okta browser plug in, which will enable you to quickly access your applications without fully signing into the dashboard. For more information, please see here: Okta Browser Plugin

Having Issues?

  • If you are having any issues setting up your account, please see Account Setup Issues .

  • If you are havng issues with Okta Verify, please see Okta Verify .


Next: How to use Okta

children.title: Okta Browser Plugin
children.content:
:pencil2:270f✏️#DEEBFF

NOTE: This page was made public so that new employees can discover what to expect before they have logged into Okta (and therefore Confluence) for the first time.

The Okta Browser Plugin is a quick and easy method for logging into your apps without having to sign into the application dashboard. To download the plugin, please click on this link: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/okta-browser-plugin/glnpjglilkicbckjpbgcfkogebgllemb?hl=en

:bulb:1f4a1💡#DEEBFF

Use cmd+shift+o and type in the application name to automatically jump into the tool!

Plug in needs Reinstalled:

If your Chrome browser loses your Okta Plugin, you may find that you need to add it back to your browser. This sometimes occurs after a system or browser update.

  1. Click the Install button and it will take you to the Google store.

  2. Click Add to Chrome.

  3. Refresh your Okta Dashboard and your apps should go back to working properly.

  4. We highly recommend ‘pinning’ your plugin extension on your browser so that it always shows in the toolbar. Click the puzzle icon shown below and then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin.
    Hint: you can do this for any plugin extension that you use often or need quick access too.

  5. Check to make sure your plugin is logged in by clicking on the icon in the toolbar. see gif at top of page.

  6. If you get a sign in button like below. Try signing completely out of your Okta Dashboard, then sign back in, it should connect your plugin back.

  7. Verify that you are also connected to login.simpli.fi and NOT simpli.okta.com

  8. If it shows simpli.okta.com technically it will still work, but there may be some instances that you get prompted for MFA again even though you are already signed in and authenticated. To fix this, click the gear icon and scroll to the bottom of the page. Click Reset Plugin button.

  9. Sign out of your Okta Dashboard and make sure you are signing in at login.simpli.fi and sign back in. The plugin should sign in you automatically. If it doesnt and you keep having issues, reach out to a team member in the #digital-workplace channel in Slack.
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: How To Use Okta
children.content:
:pencil2:270f✏️#DEEBFF

NOTE: This page was made public so that new employees can discover what to expect before they have logged into Okta (and therefore Confluence) for the first time.

Dashboard and Sign-In URL: login.simpli.fi

Username: your Simplifi email

After you have activated your Okta account, you will be sent to your application dashboard which should look something like this:

Click on any of the apps you see and you will be instantly logged in.

Signing Into Okta

When you are prompted to sign into Okta when attempting to sign into a different app, you will need to use the authentication method you chose. (See here for the setup guide: Initial Setup )

Biometric (fingerprint reader):

  1. Enter your username

  2. Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader when prompted

  3. Done!

Okta Verify:

  1. Enter your username

  2. Check your phone for the Okta Verify push notification (sometimes you need to open the app for it to show up)

  3. Press ‘Accept’

  4. Done!

Google Authenticator:

  1. Enter your username

  2. If prompted, select ‘Google Authenticator’

  3. Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone

  4. Find the six digit code located under ‘login.simpli.fi’

  5. Enter the code in your browser

  6. Enter your password if prompted

  7. Done!

Okta Browser Plugin

For even faster and more convenient method, use the Okta Browser Plugin. This allows you to seamlessly sign into all your apps without logging into the dashboard.

Okta FastPass

See here for more information:

Okta FastPass Setup Guide

children.title: Auto-Launching Applications at Okta Login
children.content:
Would you like to automagically have all of your key applications populate in browser tabs when you login to Okta for the day? You can save tile clicks by following these steps…

Instructions

  1. For any application you’d like to auto-open, begin by selecting the ... on the tile’s upper, right-hand corner.

  2. In the right-hand sidebar that opens, select Edit.

  3. Then, check the box for Auto-launch this app when I sign in.

  4. Click Save.

  5. Continue the steps above for each application you’d like to have auto-launch.

Demonstration of Instructions
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Make Okta a "Desktop Application"
children.content:
If you happen to have a LOT of tabs open ( ), you might want to investigate the option to make some of your favorite web apps into desktop applications.

With Chrome, you can achieve this for the Okta Portal by following these steps…

Instructions

  1. In your Chrome browser, navigate to login.simpli.fi (your Okta Portal).

  2. Hit the Dot-Menu on the top right of the browser settings.

  3. Navigate to Save and Share > Create Shortcut

  4. A pop-up will open, giving you the option to name your application.

    1. In the prompt for the name, you can name it whatever you’d like (even if you choose a four letter word that’s not Okta. ).

    2. Be sure to remember what you called it as you’ll want to find it later in your desktop’s Chrome Apps folder.

  5. Select the option to Open as a Window.

  6. Hit Create.

The Okta portal will now show in your desktop’s Chrome Apps. From there, you can open it, and even add it to your Macbook dock, or have it auto-open upon login to your computer.

This will work for any website (including the Simpli.fi UI!), allowing the website to be launched from your Chrome Apps folder, searched on your computer, or accessed from the docking station. And best of all, you can pull it out of the myriad tabs you might have open for the day.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Authentication Methods
children.content:
:pencil2:270f✏️#DEEBFF

NOTE: This page was made public so that new employees can discover what to expect before they have logged into Okta (and therefore Confluence) for the first time.

Skip to: How do I set an authentication method after I activated my account?

12falselistfalse

Okta Verify (Highly Recommended)

Okta Verify is a multi-factor authentication (MFA) tool offered by Okta that enables users to approve or deny attempted logins with their smartphone.

What it does:

  • adds an extra layer of security to user login by requiring a second form of authentication in addition to a password

  • gathers IP address and approximate location only when using the app

What it does NOT do:

  • access or collect any personal information on the device

How do I setup Okta Verify?

  1. On your laptop, when prompted to setup a verification method, select ‘Okta Verify’

  2. On your phone, download the Okta Verify app from your app store and open the app.

  3. In the app, click the ‘+' sign in the upper right hand corner, select ‘Organization’, ‘Skip', then 'Yes, Ready to Scan’

  4. Scan the QR code on your computer screen

  5. On your phone, it is suggested to NOT ‘Enable FaceID Confirmation’

I recently purchased a new phone and can’t get into my Okta account. What do I do?

Please contact the #simpli-okta or #digital-workplace channel for assistance.

Okta FastPass (Highly Recommended)

Please see Okta FastPass Setup Guide

Biometric Login (Recommended)

TouchID login is only available on Chrome and Safari. For more information, please see https://support.okta.com/help/s/article/Which-Browser-supports-Apple-TouchID-as-WebAuthN-factor?language=en_US

Biometric login for Okta refers to the use of biometric authentication methods, such as fingerprint or facial recognition, as a second factor of authentication in addition to a password. If you were issued a Macbook, you can use the fingerprint reader to meet this requirement.

If you have not previously setup your fingerprint reader (Touch ID) for use on your mac, go to your System Preferences > Touch ID > Add Fingerprint. If you need further assistance with this, please reach out to Desktop Support.

How do I setup biometric login?

  1. When prompted to setup an authentication method, select ‘Security Key or Biometric Authenticator’

  2. When prompted to setup a security key, click ‘Continue’

  3. Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader

  4. Done!

Google Authenticator (Not Recommended)

Google Authenticator is a mobile app that generates time-based one-time passcodes (TOTP) for use in two-factor authentication (2FA) processes. The app generates a new passcode every 30 seconds, which can be used to log into an account on a new device or after a password reset. This method may be more cumbersome to use than the others.

How do I setup Google Authenticator?

  1. Download the Google Authenticator app from the app store.

  2. When prompted to choose your authentication method, select ‘Google Authenticator’

  3. Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone

  4. Within the app, press the rainbow plus sign button in the bottom right hand corner, then select ‘Scan QR code’

  5. Scan the QR code with your phone

  6. Click ‘Next’ on your computer

  7. Enter the code listed under ‘login.simpli.fi’ on your Google authenticator app

  8. Done!

How-do-I-setup-an-authentication-method-after-I-activated-my-account?How do I setup an authentication method after I activated my account?

  1. Log in to your Okta dashboard (https://login.simpli.fi) .

  2. Navigate to the Okta settings page (top right, under your name)

  3. Under ‘Security Methods’ you can setup, reset, or remove your authentication methods.

  4. Choose your desired security method and follow the instructions above.

Next: How do I use Okta?
children.author: Kaitlin Purdham

children.title: Giving Okta the Finger
children.content:
If you have a Macbook with Touch ID functionality, you can bypass the back-and-forth of push notifications and code entry. (Estimated setup time of instructions: < 2 minutes…)

Look for this button in the upper, right-hand corner of your keyboard.

If you have a PC for work, you can contact to setup Windows Hello such that you, too, can use biometric authentication.

Instructions

  1. Begin by following these instructions to setup your Macbook TouchID if you have not already done so.

    Once setup, you can also use the TouchID key to login to your computer every day (except after major software updates; that still requires a password).

  2. Log into Okta as you normally would.

  3. Open the Okta Verify app on your computer. This is a round 'O' with a check mark in it in the top task bar of your machine.

  4. Make sure you are on the latest version of OV by clicking the About section.

    You should be on at least version 9.10

    Once confirmed, you can close this window out and go back to your Okta Verify main window, shown below.

  5. Click on your account.
    If not shown and is asking you to setup up.
    Click New account and set login.simpli.fi as the sign-in URL

    Following the redirect to your browser.

  6. Please ensure you are being redirect to login.simpli.fi NOT simpli.okta.com

  7. You will be prompted to authenticate your account in a new window.

  8. Click on your account, and enable touchID.

  9. If your Okta Verify desktop client has alerts on the icon, please follow its instructions to update your operating system.


    1. When logging in, you will see a Touch ID popup. Make sure the finger area is highlighted red; if not, click anywhere in the box.

Okta will remember the last authentication method you chose when logging you in the next time. But if for any reason it does not, simply select Verify with something else and select the Okta FastPass option. It should remember going forward!

Troubleshooting touchID

There may be times when your touchID just stops working or needs to be re-synched to your Okta account. This will sometimes happen after an OS update or Okta Verify update.
1. Open the Okta Verify app located in the top task bar of your laptop.

  1. Check to make sure your account is listed, click on your account to go to the touchID section.
    If you do not see your account, then you will need to register your device to your account.

  2. If you do not see any error messages here or any notifications. Toggle the touchID button off/on and it should prompt you to Re-Authenticate your account and connect your touchID.

    *** NOTE ***
    Make sure you have your phone available in order to MFA with Okta Verify or another MFA source that you have previously set up.

  3. There may be some instances where you will need to Re-enroll if your MFA was reset for a device. Click the Re-enroll link and register your machine.

If you use a password manager in addition to Okta (like Dashlane), please be aware that Okta puts security keys and biometric authentication in the same bucket, so to speak. So when you have a security key provided by Dashlane, it may not know to default to your Macbook biometric authenticator.

Simply click Verify with something else after you first enter your email address. Click the option for Security Key or Biometric Authenticator and select the option that is not the security associated with your password manager.
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: Okta FastPass Setup Guide
children.content:
Okta FastPass allows you to sign in without entering your password. It utilizes Okta Verify installed locally on your laptop (this is separate from the Okta browser plugin).

If you setup Okta FastPass, you MUST have a another authentication method. Okta FastPass does not work in all scenarios and only works on the laptop you have installed Okta Verify on. In order to prevent account lockouts, please ensure you have another authentication method setup like Okta Verify (on your phone), Google Authenticator, etc.


Before you begin, please make sure you have completed the following prerequisites:

  • Ensure your Okta account is activated and ready for use.

  • Install Okta Verify on your laptop. This should be automatically pushed to your machine - if you do not see it installed you will have the option to install the software when you click on the FastPass button.

The following instructions are for Mac devices. For indications of the user experience for Windows users, please see Okta’s documentation. We are currently investigating the implementation of Windows Hello.

Initial Setup (MacOS)


Skip to: Video of the full setup process

  1. Click on ‘Sign in with Okta FastPass’ button. You may need to click it twice.

2. Okta Verify on your machine will open up to this screen. Click ‘Add Account’

  1. Your default web browser will launch and display the Okta login page. Enter your Okta username and click 'Next'. Follow the prompts to sign into your Okta account.

  2. After successfully signing in, Okta Verify will open again and prompt you to add your Touch ID with Okta Verify. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete this process.

5. Once you have successfully added your Touch ID, you are now ready to use Okta FastPass!


Video-of-the-full-setup-processVideo of the full setup process:

There is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps? If you don't see it, click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. From here you can quickly log in to your account and quick access to ALL your apps!
children.author: Kaitlin Purdham

children.title: Okta Troubleshooting Guides
children.content: <ac:structured-macro ac:name="children" ac:schema-version="2" data-layout="default" ac:local-id="e882ae97-4c58-488b-9c36-972cd47a4ea6" ac:macro-id="b82c52b035d95c14f6cb46ee931b6450"><ac:parameter ac:name="all">true</ac:parameter></ac:structured-macro>
children.author: Bill Price

children.title: Avoiding Re-authentication
children.content:
:upside_down:1f643🙃#FFFAE6

Okta’s expected behavior is to operate like our headquarters' doors--quickly flash your badge and you have access to what you need to do your work. You should not have to use your badge to get into every office room, so to speak, once you’ve already shown your credentials to get in the front door.

In February 2024, we noticed that users were being prompted to authenticate in individual applications after already providing their credentials at login. This is not expected behavior.

Funnily enough, Okta would also show the user as having logged in 54 years ago (since the dawn of the Unix Epoch!) before asking them to re-authenticate with each click of an application tile.

To avoid this, we recommend taking the following steps…

none

Upgrade to the Optimal Okta Experience

  1. Ensure you have the latest Okta Verify desktop client.

    1. Many will have received this update already to their workplace computers via an action taken by the Desktop Support team on February 7, 2023. If not, it is included:

    2. For more context on the desktop client of Okta Verify (Fast Pass) see the following resource: Okta FastPass Setup Guide

  2. When prompted, sign into the Okta Verify desktop client by adding a new account (remove your other one if still present).

    1. Click New account and set login.simpli.fi as the sign-in URL

    3. Following the redirect to your browser.

    4. Please ensure you are being redirect to login.simpli.fi NOT simpli.okta.com

  3. Follow the steps to re-enable your Touch ID (see Okta FastPass Setup Guide )

  4. If your Okta Verify desktop client has alerts on the icon, please follow its instructions to update your operating system.

  5. If you are in the Chrome browser, reset your Okta Chrome extension:

    1. Settings > Extensions > Manage Extensions > Okta Browser Plugin > Details > Extension Options > Reset Plugin

  6. After ensuring you have the most up to date Okta Verify desktop client and an updated MacOS (as applicable), log into the Okta Portal (login.simpli.fi) and try clicking an application tile. You should now be able to click into applications without being prompted to re-authenticate.

Give Okta the Finger

As a general rule, it’s best to ensure you have everything up to date (your operating system, Okta Verify, etc.) But in addition, we HIGHLY recommend setting up touchID with your Macbook or WindowsHello with your PC where available.


Biometric authenticators, such as touchID, allow you to sign into your Macbook and into your Okta dashboard with only your finger. No need for password, typing in a code, OR searching for a password notification. Super fast and Super easy. Follow these steps…
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Okta Help
children.content:
← Back to Okta Sign-In Page

Okta is an on-demand service that allows you to easily sign in to all the applications your organization uses through a single login.

Once you sign in, your Okta home page displays all your applications in one location. Simply click the application's corresponding icon, and the application will open in a new browser window--passing your successful login into the application. (Note: if you’d like to bypass all clicking and have applications auto-launch upon sign-in, see these instructions.)

Frequently Asked Questions

33falsenonelistfalse

What should I do if I forget my password?

Click Forgot Password on your organization's sign-in page.
Choose an option to reset. If you have a working MFA on your phone, you should be able to reset with that or you can send email. This usually sends an email to your personal and work emails.

I have a new device. How do I reset my MFA?

See the documentation provided here: New Phone, Who Dis? : Okta After a Device Change .

How do I sign into Okta?

Open a web browser and enter http://simpli.okta.com.

Then, enter your username (company email) and password and select Sign-in. Proceed with your authenticator of choice.

How I report a security issue related to Okta?

Send an email to digitalworkplace@simpli.fi & security@simpli.fi documenting what happened. Attach any notable screenshots that could be useful.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: New Phone, Who Dis? : Okta After a Device Change
children.content:
If you get a new phone (or new work computer!), the Digital Workplace Solutions team can work with you to reset authenticators in Okta that were tied to your former device. What follows are some steps you can take (and supporting documentation) to setup your new device for seamless login…

16falsedisclistfalse

It is ideal for you to have multiple authenticators established so that if one of your devices is not working, is replaced, or lost, you have other ways to verify your identity. In order of ease to use and security level, we recommend the following:

  1. Biometric authenticator

  2. Okta Verify on your computer

  3. Okta Verify on your phone

  4. Google Authenticator (not recommended, but it is an option).

Instructions: If You Only Have Authenticators on Replaced Device

  1. Reach out to the Digital Workplace team in our Digital Workplace Slack channel, letting us know you got a new device.

  2. We will reset any authenticators tied to your new device from within the Okta Admin Portal.

  3. You will then need to set up impacted authenticators by following these instructions.

Instructions: If You Have Authenticators Across Devices

:mobile_phone:1f4f1📱#DEEBFF

For example, say you had biometric authentication setup on your Macbook and integrated with Okta biometric authenticator. If you get a new phone, you may not be able to login to Okta with your Okta Verify App on your phone, but you could use the biometric method to get into Okta. You can select, Verify with something else when logging into Okta to change how you authenticate. Then, once logged in you could update your settings.

If you happened to already have other authenticators established that are not impacted by the new device, you can log into Okta.

  1. On your laptop, go to login.simpli.fi and login with your alternate authentication method

    1. You can select, Verify with something else when logging into Okta to change how you authenticate.

  2. Select the drop-down menu by your name in the upper, right-hand corner of the Okta portal.

  3. Select My Settings.

  4. Identify the Security Methods settings.

  5. Remove the replaced device

  1. Click ‘Set up another’

  1. Verify with your alternative authentication method

  2. On your phone, download the Okta Verify app from your app store and open the app.

  3. In the app, click the ‘+' sign in the upper right hand corner, select ‘Organization’, ‘Skip', then 'Yes, Ready to Scan’

  4. Scan the QR code on your computer screen

  5. On your phone, it is suggested to NOT ‘Enable FaceID Confirmation’

  6. Done!  

Instructions: Enabling touchID login on your Mac

https://simplifi.atlassian.net/l/cp/sc7H3qVZ
children.author: Kaitlin Purdham

children.title: Signing into corporate apps on a mobile device
children.content:
To access company apps on a mobile device, you must download either Okta Verify or Google Authenticator to your phone. To add a mobile app to your authentication methods, please follow these instructions:

  1. Using your work laptop, log in to your Okta dashboard (https://login.simpli.fi) .

  2. Navigate to the Okta settings page (top right, under your name)

  3. Under ‘Security Methods’ you can setup, reset, or remove your authentication methods.

  4. Choose your desired security method and follow the instructions above.

Okta FastPass is compatible with mobile devices, but it requires you to install and set up the Okta Verify app on your device first.

Authentication Methods

Slack

  1. Click on ‘Sign in with workspace URL’

  2. Enter your sign-in URL: “si-fi”

  3. Click on ‘Sign in with OKTA’

  4. After being redirected to Okta, input your username (full email) and password.

  5. You may encounter the ‘Choose your security method’ screen to select your authentication method, or you will be automatically redirected to your Okta Verify Push Notification or the Google Authenticator code.

  6. Accept the push notification or enter the code provided by the Google Authenticator app.

Gmail

  1. Open the Gmail app. If you are already signed into your personal account, click on your profile picture and select ‘Add Another Account.’

  2. On the ‘Set up email’ page, choose ‘Google.’

  3. Enter your full email address.

  4. You will be redirected to Okta; enter your username (your full email) again.

  5. Input your password.

  6. You may be directed to the ‘Choose your security method’ screen to select your authentication method, or you will be automatically taken to your Okta Verify Push Notification or Google Authenticator code.

  7. Accept the push notification or enter the code provided in the Google Authenticator app.

  8. Agree to Google’s terms of service.

  9. Allow a few minutes for your account to load.

Zoom

  1. Launch your Zoom app and click on ‘Sign In’

  2. On the following page, choose ‘Sign in with SSO’

  3. Input our company domain: “simpli-fi”

  4. When Okta opens, enter your username (your full email address).

  5. Type in your password.

  6. You may be directed to the ‘Choose your security method’ screen to select your authentication method, or you might be automatically redirected to your Okta Verify Push Notification or the Google Authenticator code.

  7. Accept the push notification or enter the code displayed in the Google Authenticator app.
children.author: Kaitlin Purdham

children.title: Okta Password Reset
children.content:
If you’re ever embarrassed by being locked out of your Okta portal, or hesitant on whom you should ask for help when forgetting your Okta password? Fret no more! You are able to reset your Okta password at any time, provided you have access to Slack. Here are some steps you can take…

Steps to Reset Your Password: Okta Slack App

  1. Add the Okta app to Slack by clicking on the Apps section of your Slack sidebar menu.

  2. Click Manage > Browse Apps

  3. In the Apps search bar, type Okta.

  4. Add it to your Slack Apps (it has already been configured for access and is available to employees in both Slack workspaces).

  5. It should now appear in your Slack sidebar.

  6. When you to reset your password, simply click the Okta app under your Slack sidebar Apps section.

  7. From the drop-down menu of self-service options, select Okta Password Reset.

  8. Enter your company email in the User Email field in the prompt.

  9. Click Submit.

Steps to Reset Your Password: Slack Shortcut

  1. From any message box in Slack, enter the following shortcut /access Okta Password Reset

    1. For example, if you’re about to type in the Digital Workplace Slack channel, instead of typing your need, enter the above command.

    2. Once you’ve typed it, press the send button.

  2. You will then be re-directed to complete steps to provide information for the reset. To proceed, click Continue.

  3. Enter your company email address in the field when prompted, and click Submit.

:slac:f4e82d95-e425-4ecc-9954-e6ba642cb0c5:slac:#FFFAE6

Friendly reminder that there are many self-service access options resolved by utilizing the Okta Access Request portal! You obviously cannot use that if you’re unable to login to Okta (as in the case above). However, it’s there for other access needs, and is what determines the Access Request choices you have available in the Slack app and Slack shortcut. See instructions here!
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Okta Verify
children.content:
You likely already made use of Okta Verify in setting up your access. But now you’re encountering some issues with your mobile device’s Okta Verify application. Please see the below troubleshooting tips. If you still encounter issues after perusing these resources, don’t hesitate to reach out in the #digital-workplace Slack channel for assistance.

Can’t add my existing account to a new or existing device

Issue

  • I have a new device, but I can’t add my existing Okta Verify account.

  • I lost my device. How do I install Okta Verify on my new device?

  • I set up Okta Verify already but deleted the app from my device.

  • I had to factory reset my device.

Solution

Your Okta Verify account might still be tied to your original app installation. Installing the app on the new device or reinstalling the app on your current device and adding the account back might not be enough. These are some possible solutions:

  • Sign in to simpli.okta.com and tap the arrow next to your username. Go to Settings and remove Okta Verify. Then, set up Okta Verify again. See Restore Okta Verify on the same Android device or Restore Okta Verify on the same iOS device.

  • If you lost your original device, sign in to your Okta End-User Dashboard with a different security method. See Sign in to resources protected by Okta.

  • If Okta Verify is your only security sign-in method and you can’t access your account, contact your help desk.

  • If your problem persists, please reach out to the #digital-workplace channel.

Can’t sign in with push notifications

Issue

  • The sign-in page tells me to check Okta Verify, but the app doesn't receive the push notification.

  • I can't sign in to my account even if I approve the push notification sent to my device.

Solution

Ensure that these conditions are met:

  • In Okta Verify on your device, you have an account for your organization.This organization provides the app that you are trying to sign in to.

  • Okta Verify notifications are turned on.

  • The date and time on your device are set to automatic. The clock on your device must be in sync with the time maintained by your cellular provider’s network. Small differences between your device clock and the network clock can cause issues.

  • The latest version of Okta Verify is installed on your device. For details, see Set up Okta Verify on Android devices or Set up Okta Verify on iOS devices.

  • See Troubleshoot missing Okta Verify push notifications on iOS devices.

If your problem persists, please reach out to the #simpli-okta channel.

children.title: Duplicate Tiles in Okta Dashboard
children.content:
Summary

Your Okta dashboard has tiles for:

  • Applications that the Digital Workplace Solutions team put behind Okta administration.

  • Applications that are not currently behind Okta, but that the Digital Workplace Solutions team added to all users for purposes of easily maintaining credentials (such as our Simpli.fi UI, which does not yet have SSO capabilities).

  • Applications that you as a user added by allowing Okta to save your password for sites you visit.

In the case of the latter, keep in mind that the Digital Workplace Solutions team does not manage those tiles. You have the ability to edit their contents (tile display name, the redirect URL, user name, password, auto-launch capabilities) and even remove the tile.

Sometimes, when you allow Okta to save a password for you, it might save multiple tiles (say, in cases where you entered new credentials), just like Google Chrome Password Manager might save multiple sets of credentials. If you have duplicate tiles, you are able to remove an outdated one by:

  1. Hovering over the duplicate tile.

  2. Clicking the tile.

  3. In the side panel that opens on the left, clicking “Remove.”

Video Tutorial
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Disrupting the Infinite Okta Sign-On Loop
children.content:
Have you ever felt like you’re getting the worst kind of deja vu when you try to log into Okta?

Watch if you want to feel pain for over two minutes…

First Line of Defense: Shutting Down Your Browser

Completely shut down Chrome or Firefox.
(Please DO NOT simply click the red 'x' as this does not completely shut down the browser.)

  • Often, this will fix the issue without having to lose any of your browser history.

  • If the issue resolves, you can stop at this step.
    Note: If you have not setup touchID with your Macbook, check these steps on how to configure. One touch with your finger and you can log into your Mac AND all your Okta apps.

Instructions for Further Troubleshooting

  1. Be sure you are logging in at http://login.simpli.fi/

  2. If you are using a password manager like 1Password, disable it for this site. Alternatively, manually copy/paste the Okta password from 1Password into Okta.

When disabling 1Password for the Okta site (whether login.simpli.fi or simpli.okta.com), you can allow Google Chrome Password Manager to save your password instead. Okta is friendlier with Google Chrome Password Manager than it is with 1Password at this time.

  1. If it appears to only be impacting the experience in Chrome, clear your browsing data for at least 7 days in Chrome settings. (You can go back further if needed as shown below.)

    chrome://settings/privacy

  2. If clearing the cache doesn’t seem to resolve the issue, try rebooting your computer.

  3. In the top right of your Chrome browser, look for a small Okta icon

  4. Click on the icon for the dropdown menu.

  5. Click the person icon here and you should see your account listed.

  6. Click on the link to open a new connection and log in.

    1. Note: This toolbar icon for the Okta Chrome extension is a quick way to access all of your apps. We do recommend that you sign in first.

    2. This Okta Chrome extension allows you to sign in once and you will not be prompted to sign in for the rest of your day.

Preventative Medicine

  1. In order to prevent this from happening again, be sure to check the Keep me signed in option.

  2. Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date. Sometimes you may see an icon in the upper right hand corner letting you know a Relaunch is needed.

  3. Please do not ignore these update messages for an extended period of time. These patches often times fix known bug issues and also reduces our security exposure with vulnerabilities.

  4. Even if you do not see this label, often times updates are still needed. You can check that by going to /Settings / About Chrome. (See also, documentation of steps from Google.)

  5. Once you have cleared your cache and ensured all updates are applied. Close any open tabs you have open for Simplifi’s Okta page and then reopen at http://login.simpli.fi/.

  6. If Chrome is still having issues, Safari or Firefox will work with out any issues.

As always, if you need further assistance, reach out in the Digital Workplace Slack channel.

Note: If you have not setup Mac’s touchID setting, we HIGHLY recommend you do this. It is a fast and easy way to log into your Macbook and your Okta account with just the tip of your finger. No need for username/pw or even finding your phone to get a code or Push notification.
Look for this circle on the power button.

Here is the link on how to set touchID up with your macbook.

Giving Okta the Finger

There is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps? If you don't see it, click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. From here you can quickly log in to your account and quick access to ALL your apps!
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Okta Login Email Changes
children.content:
Introduction

If your email changes for Okta (whether due to a change of domains to @simpli.fi email domain, a new user name for legal name changes, etc.) your logins to relevant tools will also change. Some applications will update automatically, where others require manual action. Some might require manual action on your part if you are using Okta tiles as a credential holder for non-company-managed applications.

If anything needs to change on your email, begin by contacting the Digital Workplace Solutions ( ) team about the change. And we will coordinate with you on an ideal day and time for your schedule.

If you are viewing this page because your gotoadvantage.com account is changing to a simpli.fi email domain, please see the bottom of this page for additional context.

https://simplifi.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DW/pages/3969908740/Okta+Login+Email+Changes#Current-Status-of-User-Accounts-Transitioned-from-gotoadvantage-Domain

Applications Requiring Manual Steps from You

There are a few apps that Okta doesn't manage that you would have to update on your end (if you used your gotoadvantage.com account originally for these). Some examples of apps that are not connected with Okta:

  1. Rippling (most people use their personal email to log into this anyway)

  2. HSA if applicable (related to Rippling; it is recommended to use your personal email)

  3. Fidelity (most people use their personal email for this as well)

  4. AppleID (if applicable; not everyone has a Macbook or signed up for Apple App Store)

  5. IcePanel (if applicable)

  6. Bitwarden (if applicable; it is preferred for you to change your email in the settings so as not to lose any personal use of Bitwarden for passwords.)

  7. Browserstack (if applicable, will assist in changing logins for developers)

  8. Any app integrations you use for Atlassian (Jira / Confluence) need to be re-authorized with the Simpli.fi account. You will be prompted to do so when clicking into a relevant app (e.g., Google Sheets, Scribehow)

  9. Outlook (if you use Outlook, please update your Gmail settings accordingly to send from both email accounts).

    1. Once logged into Gmail website in your browser, go to the settings gear

    2. Select See All Settings in the right-side panel that opens

    3. Click the Accounts and Import section

    4. Under the Send mail as sub-section, click Add another email address and enter your gotoadvantage email as an additional account.

    5. Click Save to keep this change.

  10. Windstream (if you have this tile in Okta, it is a “Bookmark Tile” that we cannot manage, but you can edit in the Windstream application and edit your tile in Okta to match once done). The #facilities-enduser-support team can assist with Windstream if needed.

Applications Requiring Manual Steps from Digital Workplace Team

  1. Signite for new account email signature

  2. Confirmation of Zendesk functionality (ensure no customer/end-user account duplication)

  3. Confirmation of Salesforce functionality (ensure no conflict with user having @simpli.fi account in another Sandbox instance).

  4. Confirmation of Zoom functionality (ensure no pre-existing @simpli.fi email account)

  5. DataDog (confirm manual override of user given recent provisioning through Okta)

  6. Perimeter81 (verification that a duplicate account not created)

  7. Atlassian Group (addition to the Atlassian group for all-advantage in Okta)

  8. Bitwarden (manually override user if they are unable to do so themselves)

  9. Bullseye (Digital Workplace contact for user email change)

Current Status of User Accounts Transitioned from gotoadvantage Domain

In the fourth quarter of 2023, a decision was made to update all gotoadvantage accounts to simpli.fi email domains. This was in part for seamless login experience for the user (fewer credential combinations to maintain, or discrepancies between Okta logins). It was also prioritized due to the pending change from Rippling HRIS to UKG HRIS, effective January 1, 2024.

To review current status and scheduled day/time of changes for employees on your team, please see this spreadsheet and related Jira Task.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: The Okta-phant in the Room
children.content:
Sure, there’s no such thing as an Okta-phant. But on the Digital Workplace team, we understand that whenever Okta is mentioned, it garners an exhausted eye-roll from some and trepidatious avoidance from others. We hear you. We get it. We believe it’s our job to listen and make it better for all Simpli.fi users.

You’ll never hear us claim that Okta is perfect. But it does have some benefits:

  • Just last quarter Okta prevented and blocked over 200 threat actors.

  • We have saved ~100K since its implementation in license reductions and mistaken assignments.

  • Onboarding efforts reduced significantly (estimated 95% speed-up in application assignments)

Even if you do not feel these benefits in your day-to-day, there are a few things we can recommend to make Okta helpful. What follows are some tips for making Okta work for you...

none

Logging into Okta with a Touch

You may have seen my reference to “Giving Okta the Finger” in the Digital Workplace channel. It’s true! You can log into Okta without having to check your phone for a code. Simply follow the instructions in the aforementioned article, and you, too, can enter Okta with a quick touch. Please note, the instructions are catered toward Macbook TouchID setup. However, if you would like Windows Hello for the purposes of biometric authentication, you can work with the Digital Workplace Desktop Support Sub-team to obtain that functionality.

Auto-launching Applications in Okta

Okta works best if you log into it directly from simpli.okta.com at the beginning of your day. So when you’re sipping your first cuppa, log into Okta. We’ve set the session limit for the portal to last beyond your eight hour work day. If you’re logged in there first, you shouldn’t have to log into each of your applications in separate browser tabs. (Some notable exceptions to this are applications, like UKG, that log users out after an hour of activity due to privacy concerns).

If you don’t enjoy clicking the Okta tiles, you can auto-launch applications of your choosing each time you log into the Okta portal. That additionally applies for any web apps you store in Okta tile password management, or custom application tiles you create. (That’s right, ‘there’s a tile for that' if you want it--not just apps that Simpli.fi manages.) Check out these instructions for obviating the need to click tiles.

Using the Okta Chrome Extension

If you want to feel like an Okta power user or hate clicks in general, the Okta Chrome Extension is for you. It has been automatically added to every employee’s Chrome browser. With a simple COMMAND + SHIFT + O, you can begin typing the name of the application you’re wanting to access, hit ENTERand voilà! See more details on utilizing the extension…

Improving Employee Experience through Okta Workflows

We know employees may not understand the behind-the-scenes work that Okta does in provisioning applications. If we’re doing our jobs, you won’t even think about it. However, as a peek behind the curtain, we can share that: Okta Workflows automate nearly every event-based application update.

As one recent example, Kaitlin Purdham used an Okta workflow to provide UKG attributes to the Slack API. Now you can see your colleagues' place in the org chart, their manager, their direct reports (if applicable), their official title, and their start date--all from with an application where you spend most of your time. (Fun fact: thanks to this attribute mapping, your Slack profile now throws you a party on your work anniversary!)

We have dozens of Okta workflows to provide the personalized touches that enhance your experience.

In short, if there’s an Okta-oddity thwarting your optimal workflow, don’t suffer in silence. If there’s an idea you have to improve operational efficiencies, let us know. Chances are, there’s something further we could do (with Okta) to improve your digital workplace.
children.author: Ashley Graham

children.title: Perimeter 81
children.content:
16falsenonelisttrue

What is Perimeter 81?

Perimeter 81 is Simplifi’s VPN solution that is broken down by specific networks, where access is maintained by group memberships.

Feel free to check out these resources for more detailed information:

  • Tutorials: https://www.perimeter81.com/video#tutorials

  • Knowledge Base: https://support.perimeter81.com/docs

AdOps' SWAT team members, for example, use P81 to test ads in different locations. They also use it to add certain lat_loc,lon_loc to the Geo Filter via these steps. To do so, they need access to the GCP-PRD network.

Additionally, accounting and SWAT team members use the VPN to access Bidtellect’s on-prem Looker solution. To do so, they need access to the BT-Tools network.

The engineering team largely uses GCP-HA-PRD, GCP-PRD, and GCP-HA-DEV as we are moving away from server solutions with IBM. Though, IBM_SWAT and IBM_VPN are still available during this transition to Google Cloud services.

Requirements

  1. MAC OS needs to no less than Big Sur, preferably higher
    ** note: will not install or run from the application page if not updated

  2. Windows machines needs to have all updates installed.

  3. Okta username/account

Requesting Access

There are several ways you can request access into the P81 environment. The Digital Workplace team has a built out automated self-service request that allows you to have quick access to the platform.

Slack <> Okta Application Request

  1. In Slack, search for the Okta app under apps.

  2. If you do not see the Okta app, simply click the Add apps option and select the Okta app.

  3. Under the Home tab, click the Choose a resource option and choose Perimeter 81 Membership.

Slack <> Okta Shortcut Request

  1. Alternatively, from within the #digital-workplace channel by typing in the command below directly in the channel…

    1. /access Perimeter 81

  2. Follow the prompt to confirm that you would like Perimeter 81 access.

  3. In the prompt, enter in your simpli.fi email address and click Submit.

Okta Access Request Portal

  1. From your Okta dashboard, click on the tile named Okta Access Request.

  2. This will open a separate console for you to request the Perimeter 81 app (along with many other apps).

  3. Click Request access and you will be prompted with same or similar steps and questions as above.

  4. Fill out the request form with your email address only, no other tet or multiple users.

  5. Currently, the request can only accept a single network at this time, if you need access to more than one network, please reach out to the #digital-workplace team.

Downloading the Harmony SASE (Perimeter 81) App

  1. Follow the link below to download the correct install file.

    1. https://support.perimeter81.com/docs/downloading-the-agent

  2. Once installed, look for the app in your task bar area.

  3. Click Sign In. A browser window will open up.

  4. Upon first time logging in, if prompted for a company URL, use simplifi .perimeter81.com

  5. Click the Sign in with Okta button.

  6. If you are already signed into your Okta dashboard, the authentication will be automatic. Otherwise, you will be prompted for your Okta credentials.

  7. Click the Checkbox to always allow and click Open Perimeter 81.

  8. Once you are successfully logged in, you will be able to see your available networks under Private Networks. along with Quick Access.

Troubleshooting Examples

  1. Issue resolving DNS names on GCP production.

    1. Problem- Able to resolve the FQDN cmak.service.consul, but not just by using cmak.

      Note: Works correctly on GCP dev and IBM.

    2. Possible resolution- P81 support recommended running the following command on MacBooks

      1. sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder

      2. Reference tickets:

        1. https://help.perimeter81.com/support/tickets/71161

        2. INF-4390de512a56-1921-37b5-8a2a-d608ea4d8393System Jira

  2. Issue accessing desktop client applications (e.g. Slack) when connected to the VPN:

    1. Ticket for issue on December 13, 2024

    2. Troubleshooting in Slack between DW, Infrastructure, and end user (Jason Hatton)

    3. Resolution Steps identified by Jason Hatton

Jason's Troubleshooting Steps (Last Step Did it!)

  1. Flush DNS Cache

    1. sudo dscacheutil -flushcache

    2. sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder

  2. Compare DNS config

    1. scutil --dns

  3. Check for local or custom DNS stuff

    1. sudo lsof -i :53

    2. cat /etc/hosts

    3. ls -la /etc/resolver/

  4. Remove suspicious resolver entry

    1. sudo rm /etc/resolver/test

  5. Check proxy settings

    1. networksetup -getwebproxy "Wi-Fi"

    2. networksetup -getsecurewebproxy "Wi-Fi"

  6. Examine network services and their order

    1. networksetup -listallnetworkservices

    2. networksetup -listnetworkserviceorder

  7. Check DNS servers

    1. networksetup -getdnsservers "Wi-Fi"

  8. Reset network config files (this is what worked)

    1. sudo rm /Library/Preferences/SystemConfiguration/NetworkInterfaces.plist

    2. sudo rm /Library/Preferences/SystemConfiguration/preferences.plist

    3. sudo reboot
